Reviews.Title: “Almost There”
Reviews.Author: ridethestallion
Reviews.Content: The Eliot Hotel is a luxury boutique hotel. No doubt about it. But something is missing in the service department. The physical structure of the place is warm and inviting. My first reaction to seeing our room was that heaven must have had a sale on fabrics. From the linens to the drapes to the towels, there are plush fabrics everywhere. As result, the hotel is warm and comfortable and rather quiet given its location. And, for a hotel stay in the dead of a Boston winter, there probably is not a warmer or warmer feeling hotel in town. However, the warmth ends with the structure of the hotel. The front desk service is tops. However, the bar staff, cleaning crews, and restaurant staff just seem mildly indifferent. It's as though the hotel has "done enough" to compete as a luxury hotel and the staff lacks the incentive to do more. And for the prices commanded by the Eliot (basic rooms starting at $350-450/night), the hotel should reflect a stronger commitment to serving its customers. * Requests for additional pillows for the room required a couple of calls to the front desk (I offered to go down to the front desk myself but was assured the staff would handle it), and they were delivered an hour later. * When we visited the bar (each evening over a 4-night stay), the bar staff were, well, just tepid. Simply not engaged with us or any other customer that entered the bar. I've worked in the hospitality/food service industry for years. Yes, when staff is busy, no one should expect endless, buoyant conversation. But we did not see the bar staff doing much of anything. Perhaps there is a management issue that translates into a lack of morale with the staff. Just a guess. Yes, the Eliot is a contender for greatness. The look, feel, location, and pricing of the hotel put the Eliot in top tier range. And I am rooting for the Eliot to succeed! It has almost everything it needs to be one of the finest hotels. But the service needs to improve. A good hotel stay is more than bricks, motor, and, in this case, fabric. A worthwhile customer experience in a hotel requires consistent, friendly service. The current lack of good customer service is what makes the Eliot a good, not great, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful decor and location with some room for improvement in service”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Eliot. I love the location and the suites contain a bedroom and a sitting room. The bathroom is nice and I appreciated having a nice big shower. Although there are many different areas in the room, the room appears a bit cramped and the layout for power sockets could be improved. The staff is a bit of a mixed bag. Some are very friendly and go out of the way to help you and others look at you as if you have asked them an incident question. I had breakfast in the Clio once and the waitress really struggled to take the order and fulfil them. Overall service is variable. I would not suggest buying the internet package of the hotel which I did. I paid for two days but could not access the internet through the AT&T connection. Instead I used a free Boston-based service. This was however slow. Charing $10 for internet that does not work is not really impressive. I would stay there again due to the service and the overall boutique style of the hotel. I also like the fact that it is family-owned. However the hotel could ensure a consistent service of their staff and should offer a fast and free internet connection in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance”
Reviews.Author: RSDCArch
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Eliot with my 19-year old son for a college visit. We had a double double suite that was a reasonable size for a boutique hotel in Boston (which means it was a bit small). The decorating is quite lovely if you are into VERY traditional Americana. Unfortunately, the television and electronics are about the same vintage - a bit disappointing after spending a day traveling. The valet parking was painless. The restaurant, on the other hand, was a big mistake. We ate there for breakfast - painfully slow service, mediocre food, and dreadfully high prices. I did complain about the service at the front desk upon departure. Got a simple, "Thank you," but nothing else. All in all it is a nice place, but for the money and the reputation it is an average experience. I am heading back to Boston is a few weeks and will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms/Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: fly_momFl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our teenage son and stayed in room 304 (a corner king suite). The room was really perfect for our needs. The separate sitting area with sofa bed and the ability to close doors to the king bed area gave all us privacy. The room was clean and tidy. We had no problems with outlets as others have written. Our bathroom had a shower only which was fine for us. The bathroom is kind of a one person at a time place but easily forgivable given the spaciousness of the suite in general. I did have to put a couple of towels on the floor because of water leaking out the glass shower door. The corner room had windows facing the streets but traffic noise wasn't really noticeable. The T stop was a few minutes walk (Hynes Convention Center). Lots of stores and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel provided a marked walking/running trail around the area with distances noted. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants. We also did not have a car. All staff members were courteous and appropriately attentive. I would really have liked to have had a small coffee maker. Thankfully there was a Starbucks a short walk away. We only stayed for one night and wished it could have been longer. We will definitely book another stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cabdella
Reviews.Content: The pros are many: the Eliot is right in Back Bay with easy access to Newbury & Boylston St, less than 2 blocks from Hynes Convention Center, and right before the on-ramp to the Masspike West. The room we stayed in (a premier suite king) was spacious and comfortable. The staff were all very attentive and polite. Even the free shoe shine was wonderful: you hang your shoes on the doorknob in a bag they provide before you go to bed and you wake up to find your shoes looking better than they have in years. My wife and I did the "Winter in the City" deal which provided free parking (a must in the Back Bay area of Boston) and a free breakfast in Clio. I'd highly recommend a breakfast package because for the cost of tax and tip, we had a complimentary $20 per person buffet with fresh fruit and some very delicious baked goods (if you want bacon or eggs and order a la carte, say goodbye to your wallet). The only cons are that the dresser was pretty small and probably could not accomodate 2 people if we stayed for several nights. Also, the shower is bizarre with a partition which only covers half the shower, so you feel like at any minute you'll flood the bathroom. I can't understand why they wouldn't have some kind of sliding door, if only to keep you from getting cold in the shower. But these are small items. Overall the Eliot is a really great hotel. You'll pay $300+ per night because of where you are in Boston, but you will get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... just lacked a few nice touches”
Reviews.Author: AbsolutelyNoBorders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eliot Hotel for our recent Wedding Anniversary and overall it was a great choice for us. The location can't be beat (walking distance from Newbury Street, public transport and anything else you might want) and the Hotel itself is consistently and deservedly voted to be Boston's best. We opted for the 'Touch of Paris' package which includes a large King Suite, dinner at their French restaurant - Clio - and buffet breakfast as well. The price is very competitive (only a small increase from what you would pay for just the room alone) so it is a very good deal. We loved loved loved the dinner at Clio... we've eaten at many of Boston's "best" restaurants and Clio is by far the best dining experience we've had in Boston ever. Every course was delicious and well presented and the service was amazing. This coupled with the beautiful Parisian furnishing of the room was worth what we paid and we would unequivocally recommend this hotel and package to anyone we talk to. On the flip side there were a couple of (admittedly small) things that could have improved our stay and would have been the difference between a 4 and a 5 star review here. The ROOM amenities. Although they advertize that the rooms associated with this package have a bath tub, ours didn't (the fine print does say actual room may vary slightly) but when the bold print says "bath tub,' one would assume a tub will be in the bathroom, instead of just a small shower and sink. Also as we got ready to go out for dinner we noticed more and more things missing from the room... firstly there was no Iron and they had to bring one up... then we realized the shaving kit didn't have everything you need to shave... then we had to call front desk again because the hair dryer is very low quality and kept cutting out... three trips up from the (very helpful) front desk staff could all have been avoided if the room was fully stocked with high quality appliances and amenities as you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. The other negative was the BREAKFAST. The package value is really in the room and the dinner... and the buffet breakfast at this hotel is really an afterthought. Bagels, Cream Cheese, Plain Yoghurt, Cereal and some average fruit constituted the $40+ buffet breakfast. Luckily we weren't too hungry and it was included in our cost, but it really isn't what you would expect from as hotel like this in the breakfast department. More of this review has come off as negative than i intended and i could probably write much more about how professional and helpful the staff were, how clean the room was and how beautiful the inside of the hotel is... but all of that goes without saying. It's a very classy establishment and it was almost the nicest hotel experience we've had in a major US city... almost. Hopefully management realizes just how close they are to giving people the perfect city escape and makes a couple of very minor adjustments to make it truly special.

Reviews.Title: “stop #1 on the college tour”
Reviews.Author: highway61nola
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights here in Feb 2012 at the start of a college tour through the Northeast. She used the fold-out bed in the sitting area of the suite, I used the king. The suite is nicely appointed. Room service was prompt and everything was hot and as ordered. We didn't make use of the minibar but did note that someone had broken off a key in it and informed the front desk of this. Despite being at a busy intersection, noise was no problem in the room. The location is good for getting to Northeastern Univ., Berklee, and BU. The other colleges and universities can be quickly reached by T-line or cab. You are steps from upper Newbury St. with its many shops and restos. The Hayes Ctr. T-line stop is at the corner of Mass. Ave. and Newbury, very convenient. You can easily catch waiting cabs in front of the hotel. As someone else noted, the rooms have very limited numbers of outlets. All the personnel were solicitous and helpful. Bringing your car around can take a good 20-25 minutes or so. All in all we were pleased and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: TheCogsShow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this boutique hotel recently and at first was very impressed with the hotel and the room. The hotel was clean and had a nice, classic feel to it. It was classic but not run down. The room was a decent size and well appointed. The bathroom was lined with marble and was clean and modern. The room was not without it's problems though. Half the outlets were lose and didn't hold the plug in the socket well. My Blackberry and laptop chargers were constantly slipping out of the outlets. This problem also plagued their own lamps. The TV didn't work at first and required servicing by the technician before it would turn on. The furnace in the room didn't work either and had the technician in and out of my room all afternoon until it was partially resolved. The heat would work but I was instructed not to adjust the temperature up or down because it could cause the heater to malfunction again. While the bathroom looked and felt nice, the shower was another story. There was no threshold between the shower and the floor for the bathroom so I had to use most of the towels to build a makeshift dike to keep from flooding the rest of the bathroom. The shower enclosure was built with glass but they never installed a shower door so the glass juts out of the wall enclosing about 70% of the shower but then there's this big opening between the shower and the rest of the bathroom. Very bizarre and poorly designed. The hotel's restaurant is prohibitively expensive and if you order anything up to the room, you are charged an annoying service fee. You're better off going to a nearby restaurant or just ordering food from an outside option. If you can score a good price for this hotel (i.e. through Priceline) then it's definitely worth staying here. It's not worth it if you're paying regular price. Prior to this trip, I've stayed at the Back Bay Hotel and the Lenox Hotel and dollar for dollar, those are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, European style Luxury and attentive service in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: CaTyLondon
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family (2 adults and 2 small children) and we are delighted we hit on the Eliot Hotel. It's a gem of a boutique hotel, perfectly placed in the Back Bay area. It's beautifully kitted out - our suite was perfect for our needs. I was also pleasantly surprised at how child friendly they were, as it is a couples dream... (and my husband and I are already dreaming of coming back without the kids!) The rooms are compact, but chic and well-proportioned, the service was superb without once being ostentatious or in your face, the food was tasty and beautifully presented and overall this was a cut above anything we have stayed in recently. That said, it is not cheap - parking, room service and any other extras come at what I would see as a high price. We loved the breakfast, as did our kids, but by US standards it is expensive, with somewhat limited options. But the positives way outweigh the negatives - some examples: a really charming and attentive room service waiter who took time and effort with his food delivery, a beautifully made up child's crib (complete with a cute baby gift set), concierges and door staff who were so helpful with the stroller, and who tried to waive away tips when I was on my own with the toddler - I could go on. I really do look forward to returning to the Eliot Hotel, both with my kids and without! I am also inspired to look at boutique hotels rather than chains, after experiencing their personal and charming service... I also must complement Bookit.com., who I booked through. I messed us the original booking (forgot the children - wishful thinking) and they were so helpful in sorting it out, also everything they promised was delivered, which in the world of online reservation companies, is a rarity - they will also be seeing repeat business from this family.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Eliot Hotel, Boston”
Reviews.Author: sbelock
Reviews.Content: Convenient to fashionable Newbury Street, Museum of Fine Arts, Symphony Hall and many Universities & area Colleges. A great spot as most of the rooms are suite-like with separate sitting areas, wet bars and updated bathrooms. Small, intimate with opportunities for fine dining in the hotel and nearby. Walk everywhere and come back to a delightful sanctuary.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating, top notch customer service.”
Reviews.Author: checkersthecat
Reviews.Content: Had to stay for my wife's work with our newborn. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean, comfortable and had an old world charm not seen in more modern buildings. Unfortunately, Clio (great restaurant) was closed for renovations during our stay, but I lived in Boston for years and my friend who lives there now had plenty of dinner recommendations. I highly recommend this place, not only for the pleasant staff but also for its handy Back Bay location and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Freeman55
Reviews.Content: Our son had an audition at Berklee College of Music. The Eliot Hotel was perfectly located and was extremely charming. The Concierge made our dinner reservations and we took advantage of an upgrade to a 2-room suite with a view of Commonwealth Avenue. We loved the hotel and recommend it if you want something other than a generic chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel, great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: TinySeasideDancer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were invited to a big party in Boston and felt it prudent not to drive home even though it is only 30 miles so we decided to stay in Boston and we chose the Eliot. It was a splendid idea! We were greet warmly by the staff, the valets wisked our cars away and we went in to the lively bar for a drink. The bartender was fabulous, had all kinds of specialty drinks and after asking each of us what sort of flavors and drinks we liked, he made us each a terrific cocktail. We each loved our rooms, great size, very comfortable beds, lovely linens and great size bathrooms with lovely amenities. We each had room service for breakfast and it was delicious, delivered promptly, with linens and china. They told us when we checked in it could take at leat a half hour to get our cars from the valet and we didn't pay attention so, my only advice would be to remember to call in plenty of time before you need your car. This is not a complaint, we were informed at check in; it's just a tip. Fabulous stay,vgreat people, fun bar and the dining room elegant. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Fantastic Area with Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: gloSantaMonica_CA
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel great aside of from its proximity to Newbury St and the Prudential Center, is its wonderful service. From my arrival, greeted by the valet service, to the room service staff, and front desk staff, my every need, request, etc. was met with perfection. The only reason the Eliot did not get a rating of 5/5 from me is the small bathroom and the relatively few outlets - the one near the desk was very inconvenient. So this may not be the best place for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Eliot Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: Roberta E
Reviews.Content: No facilities in the room for tea or coffee and restaurant in hotel very expensive, needed to get dressed up to go and have a coffee. Sounds like a small thing but after a day of walking walking walking, all we wanted to do was relax with a cup of tea/coffee in our room, not go out again. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very polite. Walking distance to the train station, but difficult to find out this information. The hotel should have had more information on transport and tourist info available would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned and intimate with great location”
Reviews.Author: Magnus W
Reviews.Content: A very cozy and somewhat old fashioned hotel in the centre of BostonÂ´s older area. I found the hotel very comfortable and inviting, nice European English style furniture which suited the building. Great location, easy to stroll around to restaurants, bars and shops in immediate proximity to the hotel. Nice Japanese restaurant in the hotel, had a very decent room service meal and found the hotel intimate, genuine and pleasant. There was a somewhat strange touch screen concept installed in the room with info only about the hotel, but other than that a very nice and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “This Gem is no Secret! The Eliot Hotel, Clio and Uni”
Reviews.Author: sandra534
Reviews.Content: I had the occasion to stay at the Eliot Hotel in Boston because of a medical conference, which was held at the Westin Hotel - this gave me the opportunity for a lovely 15 minute walk every morning and at the end of each day. The hotel is furnished in luxurious style, beautiful, clean, with comfortable beds and pleasant furnishings, but in addition, it is the ambience which makes you feel that staff really cares about YOU. Each and every staff member, at the front desk, porter, waiters, chefs, and even other guests are friendly and helpful. Staff is highly professional at all times. Room service was delicious, food was warm, and well-served. The restaurants, Clio, a Continental-Asian Fusion style, and Uni , a Sushi Bar - were outstanding, both in the creations they offered, and in the lovely service they provided, with knowledgeable and friendly, efficient staff. In addition the costs were comparable to other hotels, not at all extravagant. Yet, now let it be known, the Eliot Hotel is # 1 Boutique Hotel in America, and it is among the top 40 Hotels in the World - with rating of 94.7% overall, and one of very few hotels in America in this category !!! One can understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HHIBLONDE
Reviews.Content: Our room was right on Commonwealth Ave but you could have heard a pin drop!! IT really was that quiet.. Lots of space, great bed and fantastic pillows.. The location is wonderful and the Restaurant CLIO worth eating at..there is also a Uni Sashimi Bar in the same hotel.. we were leaving early and requested coffee brought to the room at 615.. No problem..right on time! Cant wait to go back ..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - charming decor”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a whim, tired of staying in local chains. What a great find. The hotel is boutique and charming. It's walking distance to great shops and restaurants. We dined at Sonzie right around the corner which we considered another great find. My room was HUGE! I had two double beds seperated from the sitting area by french doors. The room had a full entry way and walk in closet. I must have received a first-timers upgrade and I'm certainly not complaining. I only wish I'd had more time to enjoy the room. Bathroom is small as other reviewers commented but I had no issues. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nose-in-the-air”
Reviews.Author: War-chique
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend two nights at Eliot Hotel in November. A very pretentious place: at least two people open doors for you when you enter or exit, three waiters serve you in the hotel restaurant at a time with the fourth person responsible for your bread only. A separate guy just to push the elevator button. Tiny reception area, small elevators. We had a two room suite with windows facing an ugly back yard where they stored mattresses (see photo), and where 5 huge ventilation fans were located. Those fans produced endless noise which spoiled our stay substantially. The air conditioner/heater in the room itself was so noisy that we did not use it at all. Besides mentioned above it may be considered a good hotel: perfect location, polite personnel, spacious and clean rooms, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for girls' getaway”
Reviews.Author: MassMommy
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great weekend at this hotel. 5 women shared a 2 bedroom suite comfortably (especially for the small amount of time spent in room). We had a room with 2 double beds, a room with a queen bed and a living room with a pull-out couch - I slept on that and it wasn't bad at all. The location was great! I was concerned we would be too close to Kenmore Square, but we definitely still felt like we were in the Back Bay. We walked to the MFA, and spent a lot of time wandering around Newbury Street. Beacon Hill was also walkable. The rooms were nicer than I expected, and staff was helpful. Valet parking was pricey ($36 per 24 hours), but we knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/ Charming Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Traipsing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I joined another couple for a weekend in Boston. We found the Eliot to be perfect. We particularly enjoyed the sitting rooms, which allowed us to watch a "big" football game, read the paper, drink coffee and share good company when we were not seeing the sights. We also enjoyed the interior design and the helpfulness of the staff. We would happily return to the Eliot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, tired room”
Reviews.Author: MostlyLeisure
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in Back Bay for a week in July, and got a good deal at The Eliot Hotel. We managed to score a "suite", which was a bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette like thingy and a sitting room with pull-out couch. Flat TVs in both rooms, wireless internet (for a fee). The bathroom was tiny, no room for a toilet kit anywhere (let alone stuff for 3 people!). The fridge wasn't cold enough to chill a couple beers. On the other hand, Boston was suffering through a massive heat wave with temps above 100. Still, we really would have liked a cold brew after the afternoon walk! Speaking of the heat, the A/C was very very noisy. Perhaps it was just his particular room, but we had to have the fan on the lowest speed to make it manageable. In general, the standard was, well, old fashion. For example, there were very few electrical outlets, so charging a camera, a laptop and a couple cell phones was a logistical problem. Also, steer clear of the $30 per person breakfast buffet. Truly underwhelming. We demanded a refund after the first morning, and ate at a Greek diner around the corner on Newbury Street for the rest of the week.

Reviews.Title: “great area, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilybelle344
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location: Near the T, shopping, coffee shops, restaurants. It's also in a beautiful area - good for walking, etc..The staff was very nice, the rooms clean and above average. I would stay here again. I just had two complaints, one major and one minor. The minor one was that we had no full length mirror anywhere in the room (also no coffee), the major complaint was that even though there were two restaurants in the hotel, they were only available during certain hours. In other words, during our stay, the weather became cold and very rainy. Since we didn't feel like braving the elements, we thought it'd be nice to go down and have a cup of tea or coffee or a glass of wine. No luck. They were not open. It's best to check their hours I guess. In my opinion, in a hotel as nice as this - at least a coffee or a drink should be available anytime. (other than room service) We ended up settling for room service, stuck back in our room, and received only one cup and the coffee was luke warm. I would recommend this hotel - just be prepared to walk to a coffee shop if you're an early riser!

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds, crabby bartender and no parking”
Reviews.Author: Rikki_VB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eliot on 10/27/11 for 3 nights. Our original trip for our friends wedding to Mexico got ruined by Hurricane Rina so we (veryyy last minute) decided to take a road trip with another couple that wasn't able to get to MX. We tried the "unpublished hotels" option on Expedia. It guaranteed us 4 stars and within the immediate confines of Bean Town. Fine, we got 4 stars and within the confines of Bean Town but we also got an extremely hard bed, a weird shower with only 1 door that let the cold air in and water on the floor, a crabby and cheap (with the alcohol) bartender, and nooo parking. We spent $60 on 3 drinks and 1 ended up being a double because the bartender poured less than half the glass. My fiancÃ© asked for more and he said he'd have to charge us for a double. Go figure?!?! We're guests at the friggin hotel!! Either way, we wish we had been in Mexico and not in cold, rainy, snowy Boston. We would recommend the hotel if you're middle aged and stuck up. The Eliot is definetly not a place for a young hot couple looking to have a laid back and fun weekend. If you're looking to spend lots o' $ and get no perks (not even free wifi or a continental breakfast) stay there. One more thing.... Breakfast will run you about $25 per person. We opted for Dunkin Donuts and Mike's Diner while we were there. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Karl M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We had no problems whatsoever. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: jwilbar4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last winter, late for a review but I had to add this. This is my favorite hotel in Boston, and I have only been there once. I have stayed at a lot of hotels in Boston but none seem to compare to the great old world charm and fancy decor that this gem has. There were nice amenities in the room. The bed was plush and comfortable. Service was great we had booked our room on price line and got a great price, the first room we went to had two double beds, so they made a quick easy switch for us to a very nice king sweet. However since this change was made I was charged a extra night fee to my credit card that I could not get taken off. This was a mistake by the hotel, I think because of the change of rooms. Even though I had to pay double I still love the hotel and am sure that next time I will make sure that dose not happen again. I was so impressed by the place that I, who is all about getting the best price on anything, didn't mind paying the extra charge. This is a very rare thing for me too say. I say stay here you wont regret it just watch your charges. By the way Clio the resturant in the hotel is one of the best places you can go to eat in Boston, 5 star top notch food.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Danni0713
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic but our suite lacked a lot. First the view was terrible, I opened the curtains only to find a brick wall, nothing major but when you're paying a decent amount you would like to have some sort of view. Room service was great but expensive. Would I stay here again? Probably not

Reviews.Title: “Average at best...”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel on Friday and was greeted by doorman who took bags to room. The front desk upgraded us to a suite, however, don't be fooled as there are more suites in the hotel than deluxe rooms. First impressions of the room were nice, the view however couldn't have been any worse. Opening the dark curtains revealed a wonderful view of an alley full of dumpsters and trash. The mini fridge was cool at best and full of outrageously priced items. The living room featured a love seat and half couch with a small tv. There was also a desk with computer which had links to local attractions but it kept saying invalid login requiring a call to the front desk to reboot. The bedroom featured a king size bed but you'd be better off sleeping on the floor as it would be more comfortable. The bathroom seemed like an afterthought in our room as it was tiny, had no tub, and no counter space. Cheap towels finish off the bathroom. No matter how much we cranked up the AC the room remained warm. The people at the front desk were useless, rude, and barely spoke English. Overall I'm not sure how this hotel gets away with calling itself a luxury hotel. I've stayed in nicer Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but not Detail-Oriented”
Reviews.Author: amdgMd
Reviews.Content: A lovely, charming, traditional hotel with tasteful and welcoming decor. Suites offer a living room and bedroom separated by French doors. My suite had a foyer and a closet-sized room with sink and fridge. The highlight of the decor was the bathroom with magnificent marble and elegant sconces. If the service and facilities had been commensurate with the cultured ambience, I would have been staying at this hotel monthly for business travel for the next two years. The reasons I will not return are as follows: 1) no shampoo present the first night, 2) no local or network channels on the living room tv, 3) sagging mattress, 4) sheets that are 40% polyester, 5) room service Thai noodle dinner filled with grease and served in a tiny covered bowl with no accompaniment save rolls (not very well-balanced!), 6) no ice (requested the first night, but never materialized),and 7) when these issues were reported on a comment card, I was never contacted by any hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...poor mattress”
Reviews.Author: Rhodestraveled
Reviews.Content: A little overdue...I stayed at the Eliot last fall. What I remember. The pluses: the rooms and the hotel are beautifully decorated and well kept. The doorman was very polite and helpful. The minuses: the front desk staff...let's just say not impressed. And, the hotel bed was horrid. I have never slept on such a bad mattress in a hotel before. It felt like I was sleeping on a cardboard box. It was so uncomfortable. If you are thinking-well maybe she is too picky, I am not.. many other reviewers have noted the same thing. Would I go back? Probably not. It was so cute, that I will not debate. But, for the price I paid, the front desk staff, and the horrid mattress...I am sure there is better out there. However, it was a perfect hotel for a girls weekend, did not have a car, and everything was within reasonable walking distance and most importantly I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: yankeefan13
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night, doorman/valet/fellow at front desk were friendly. one bedroom suite, plenty of room for 4. bathroom was a bit small but clean and stocked- we were on an upper floor and it was nice and quiet, windows open. we were told they'd call us when our room was ready for 3pm checkin, but we never received a call. ice took half hour to get to room. frig wasnt cold as person who stocked it left it open/unlocked. safe good size for laptop/etc. nice location, easy access from highway. very comfortable suite. room service breakfast was prompt. would definately stay again w/ AAA discount. ate at atlantic fish w/ reservation,about a 5 -10 min walk from hotel- great service, great food. tapeos around the corner on newbury for tapas/drinks , very good.plenty of shops/eateries in the area in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jillhou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time at the Eliot. It was VERY convenient for what we needed. Staff was nice. Most nights, turndown service had even placed ice in our room which was VERy appreciated - but it was not a consistent service. We were in a 2 bdrm suite. Beds were comfy - if a little soft for my hubby. I liked the towels - nice and fluffy and not skimpy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service-will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: abdngirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with a mum-the hotel is very small but charming. The service from the doorman, front desk, room service and restaurant was excellent-just attentive enough. We had a one bedroom suite with 2 double beds-the space was amazing though the one downside was our bathroom. It was very small but nicely done. Room had plenty of storage space so suitcases etc could be put away. It's location is great- it's quiet but shops and restaurants are right there when you need them on Newbury and bolyston. There's a T station a minute from the hotel which is really handy. The decor is a little traditional but its not dated at all. Next time i'm in Boston i would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Grandma Decor”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big - 2 rooms in my 2 stays. He service is amazing and friendly. But the decor?? I'm not a huge fan of traditional/charming/new England. I like modern and refined. This hotel is the former! Service, however makes it a top choice. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: summer0807
Reviews.Content: Having read that this hotel won this year's T&L award for best small hotel in a major city, I was quite excited to got to Boston with my husband for a long weekend. We did the "Touch of Paris" for the first night.....Cleo's having won a James Beard award....needs to have better waiters. Our waitress was not very attentive and often very blase....for a weekend, you'd think this place could do better than a Plastic Flower arrangement in the center of the dining room. They need to hire a new beverage mgr. as I had to go to a 5th selection of vodka before they said they had it in stock. The Bakery Breakfast for $40 was a lot for a bagel and cream cheese.....the full breakfast actually turned out cheaper. This place "nickel and dimes" you for everything.....rooms are very outdated and need to be 'odorized'......

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: somuchtoc
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel in a good location. It was a block from Newbury Street, and within walking distance of many of the historic sights and Public Gardens Our suite was spacious and well appointed. Service was excellent. This was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Jyber209
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its Back Bay location, very convenient to where our daughter lives. We were delighted to be upgraded upon arrival from a double room to a lovely one-bedroom suite. The furnishings were very clean, comfortable and gracious. There was no view to speak of as we were on the ground floor, but the draperies were pleasant enough to gaze upon. Service was excellent -- perhaps even a bit too attentive for our taste! (We tend to be low maintenance people.) There is a small business center that can be used by one person at a time with no charge. We did not dine at the hotel so I can't speak for the food. The breakfast menu did seem pricey but we were given a $10 certificate that we could have applied. We would definitely consider staying here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: ajb6210
Reviews.Content: An elegant, european style boutique hotel in back bay. HUGE rooms, impeccably furnished and immaculate. I look forward to many more visits there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Synchro12
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is the way all great boutiques should be. The staff exemplifies courtesy and graciousness. If you stay more than once, they somehow know your name when you arrive. The tiny but elegant lobby is a good indication of your stay - character, history, and intimate. The small older elevators are perfect - I love them because they remind me that I am not in a Marriot or a Hilton, but rather someplace different and special.. The rooms are tastefully decorated, well-sized (I've stayed in both the junior suites as well as the standard rooms), and very comfortable. I'd say this is my favorite hotel to come home to after a long days work or travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location . . . better staff.”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT B
Reviews.Content: What a great location in the Back Bay! One block to shops and restaurants on Newbury and Boylston streets and the train station (so you can get anywhere in this great city in a short time). Also, a short walk to Fenway. We've stayed here twice and the staff always operate at the highest level.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: adventurestu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated as either the most romantic hotel, or one of the most romantic hotels in Boston. I don't agree. The deluxe suite, did not have a bathtub. The shower had only half a glass wall, which meant that much of the water went onto the floor. The tv didn't work properly. The computer didn't work at all. The room was lovely, but the lamp by the side of the bed didn't. Room service was okay, no better. The location was good, but not great. The staff was nice, but no better. Try to get a good price deal if you are going to stay there. It was very average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're going to Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: seacavee
Reviews.Content: Very lovely redone hotel in a GREAT location to Fenway Park. The hotel is clean,comfortable and very Handy to the Park. Beds comfortable and rates reasonable for Boston hotels. We had such a great time we are going back later in August. The restaurant Uno..fabulous..right in lobby. Only hotel I've stayed at that the room service menu has 2 grilled fenway franks on a toasted roll with chips..$12.00!! Better than at the Park!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Will be back”
Reviews.Author: liverpoolfan27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Eliot in march, we were blessed to be given a room upgrade but even without this the hotel is truely first class! Beds don't let you get up to easy in the morning, they are so comfy! Location wise the hotel is perfect. One evening of our stay, i was unwell and arrived home before my husband, the staff noticed and asked if everything was ok, and then asked my husband if i required a doctor! Brilliant attention to detail. Overall, we can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Time Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erin2131
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Eliot Hotel. Each time we visit Boston we always try to stay at this beautiful boutique hotel. This stay was just as fantastic as our previous visits. The hotel is ideally located to Newbury Street and offers beautiful views of Commonwealth Ave. This time we enjoyed breakfast at Clio. Most hotel breakfasts are usually a little pricey, however the hotel offered us a $10 breakfast voucher for their continental bakery breakfast. The food was delicious, the room beautiful and extremely clean and the location is outstanding!!!!!! We cannot wait to come back =)

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leeyuk
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is a lovely, understated, boutique hotel located in an old corner building in downtown Boston. The buildings blends well into the period architecture and I was delighted on stepping in and finding that the quiet understated air of elegance continued inside the small but cozy lobby, with polished brass rails and dark wood furniture. My room was great - a suite with a separate living area and bedroom. It had the warm ambiance of someone's living room, with plush sofas and chairs - the sort of place you can unwind at the day - with muted table lamps, but it also had modern flatscreen TVs in both rooms. The bathroom was modern and well-equipped, and the only minor complaint was a noisy airconditioner in the room. Overall, the room was surprisingly spacious - beguiling considering the small exterior appearance of the hotel. Service was generally very good - unobtrusive but efficient, the rooms well cleaned with turndown service at night. Doormen are polite and helpful. The location of the hotel is superb, with fashionable Newberry street just one street away. Shops, restaurants, Berklee school of music, are really at the hotel's doorstep. Directly across the front entrance is a shady park, and a walk straight down leads to the Charles river, with its tree-lined banks. What a wonderful blend of convenient location with scenic access! All in, I loved the welcoming peace and quiet of the Eliot - it felt special to a tired traveller, and much more intimate that the impersonal modern big hotel. It was quiet, discreet and completely in keeping with the overall character and heritage of the city. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just love the Eliot”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here on a combined work and play trip. The Eliot is always my first choice in Boston. I stayed in a double bed suite with my kids. Kids are always welcome here and there was plenty of room. There is a huge walk in closet to store all of your stuff. Wonderful living room space with a tv and computer. The bathroom is very small, but has a glass walled walk in shower. I love the location of this hotel. Newbury Street is just one block away. You can catch the T station there. There are plenty of dining, shopping and sightseeing options all within walking distance. The wonderful running trail on the Charles River is just a few blocks away. A word on the staff - always pleasant, extremely courteous and helpful. There is always a doorman to help you out. Just top rate staff at all levels. Would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location, staff and amenities. Will stay here next time I'm in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: LikesToTravel2006
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Eliot - the first several years ago was for pleasure, this time for work. The hotel is fantastic. The rooms are well-appointed, spacious, CLEAN and wonderful. The staff lent me a (brand new and HUGE) umbrella to walk to a nearby restaurant when a surprise rainstorm swept through the city. They also helped me figure out the iPod dock in my room. The front desk staff, bell men and doormen were all very pleasant, friendly and helpful. I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service.”
Reviews.Author: Adams
Reviews.Content: We live outside of Boston and have stayed in many hotels thoughout the years. This is an old brownstone that has been converted and you have the charm that is Boston in the Back Bay, along with service similar to 5 star hotels. The rooms are very nice and very clean- and we had one of the lesser expensive rooms. Pros: the location couldn't be better. You are a few blocks from the Charles River which is great for walking, running and biking. The choice of restaurants are endless on Newbury St and Boyleston St yet you don't hear the noise. If the weather is bad you can easily walk to the Prudential and Copley shops for respite. If you are up for a walk you can walk to the MFA or Fenway Park. The people at the front desk and the doorman are always friendly and helpful and can't do enough for the guests. Overall this hotel is a good value for this area. While there is no gym we used the nearby Boston Sports Club which was nicer than most hotels. Cons: Valet parking is expensive. A/C can not be adjusted on hot days ( which it was during our visit). There are no communal meeting spaces outside of your room. There is no morning coffee or an ice machine. No free Wi Fi or business center.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded space, poor A/C, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: eveeee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the July 4 holiday. Booked a one bedroom suite for the extra room -- still felt cramped with a living room and separate sleeping area. Bathroom was small. Oddly, closet was large. Too what end, I don't know. Staff was pleasant. Stayed in room 211 -- my view was tenement-like.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Travel4322
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a first rate hotel with great service Do not come to this hotel! Paid $600 a day for a suite with no air conditioning and had to call and get beds made. Better off going to Holiday Inn-same se ice level; much cheaper prices

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, sophistication, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: donkeyboyCt
Reviews.Content: In a word: Phenomenal Top notch from check-in to check out. Staff was incredibly attentive, friendly, and accomodating. When confused about how to access nearest "T" stop, doorman actually walked us to the entrance! Upon check-in, we were disappointed with first room and were immediately placed in a wonderful room overlooking Comm Ave/mass Ave. at no extra charge! Old style hotel elegance and service so rare to find. Truly a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic suite-style hotel with elegant touches”
Reviews.Author: Ullage34
Reviews.Content: The Elliot is located on Mass Ave and Commonwealth in a large, old, Boston brownstone building. In the ilk of a European hotel, the lobby is small but tastefully appointed. The rooms are suite style with a small living room area and a bedroom. The rooms are not overwhelmingly large as one might think when envisioning a suite but they are decorated in such a way as to feel substantial. The staff here, from the doorman to the managers, are gracious and responsive. The only downside to the hotel may be its location. The Elliot is on the tail end of Newbury St., and a long walk from the Gardens/Commons, Waterfront, or Financial District. It is however, close to Fenway. If the location doesn't cross it off your list it is the most charming and elegant hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is a beautiful hotel. I've stayed there 3 times and have always had a great experience. The rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed. The staff is friendly & helpful. The restaurant is phenomenal of course, and famous in its own right. Nice location, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drubaum
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on our way back from Ireland at the suggestion of my brother. I got the "full" treatment as they thought i was a returning guest! Beautiful rooms, great service. Did not eat in the restaurant in the hotel but it looked awfully nice. They did have a wine tasting going on which was excellent. Bed was SO comfortable, excellent sheets and great towels in the bathroom! Would certainly return if I'm back in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “The Eliot hotel is a fresh and unique.”
Reviews.Author: Faleesha
Reviews.Content: I come from a city that knocks down old buildings to put up newer ones. I've stayed at the Eliot everytime I've been to Boston. I enjoy the decor of the hotel. It's very French and unique. Very personal to each guest. The staff is more than helpful and accommodating. The location is perfect for walking or grabbing a cab, restaurants in and around the area.... provides touch screen computers to each room. It's very unique.... I love it! I took a photo of the snow, it was shoveled about 10 feet high :) absolutely an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: CitasDash
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is next door to the Harvard Club at the corner if Mass and Comm. I have always stayed closer to the common, but I enjoyed the proximity to the bike trail on the Charles River (3 blocks away), and the proximity to Newbury and its cafes (1 block away). The room was spacious and relaxing, although the bathroom was quite small. The service was attentive, but unobtrusive. I did not eat at the hotel, but I did eat at the chef's other restaurant Toro, and it was great. I will definitely come back. It is a relaxing retreat in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: 312Ana
Reviews.Content: I recently had the most enjoyable stay at the Eliot. Everyone that I encountered was friendly, courteous and helpful. My room was a beautiful, massive one bedroom corner suite. I had a delicious breakfast in the restaurant. The location is perfect! I will definitely go back and give the Sushi restaurant and bar a try.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: joy2travelBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and I checked the reviews for this hotel first, they seemed on balance pretty good. My personal experience, and I travel for my job, is that this hotel is a very good four star in an excellent location. The staff are warm and welcoming (in a way only smaller hotels can do well) and they can't do enough for you - Sebastian rocks as the happiest hotel reception worker we have ever met! The room we booked was a suite, as we had a friend travelling with us, it was on the eigth floor and was a corner room with good views - we could just see the Charles river. It was more like a small apartment and got 10 out of 10 from us. The sofa bed was made up for us every night, we did not get this level of service when we moved on to Manhattan, despite paying a lot more. I'm not really into chintzy decorating and this would be my only criticism it could look more modern BUT it suits the age of the hotel. We didn't use the restaurant as it was a little expensive and there were so many others within minutes walk to try - bit it was recommended to us. If you're looking for comfort, good service, nice little touches like a complimentary umbrella (it rained every day) then this hotel is for you; we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: dbb1845
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is perfectly situated to enjoy the pleasures of Boston and then retreat to a more leisurely, quit and peaceful location. Lovely small hotel with very gracious staff. Clio is in the hotel so you can enjoy a wonderful meal and then stroll back to your room. Bathrooms are small but recently remodeled and nicely appointed. Within walking distance of all of Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Appealing hotel situated close to Newbury St”
Reviews.Author: Jimmassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Attractive, well managed small hotel in heart of Back Bay, within a few strides of Newbury Street, with varied restaurants, cafes and shops. Hotel is conservatively decorated with ample sized rooms. A bit expensive for a family, but hotel does deliver value when compared to a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons and other upper-end hotels. Thoughtful, well trained staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: EM_1908
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a beautiful and convenient area. The beds are very comfortable. Clio, the main restaurant is a must. However, the washroom is tiny and the rooms are not as clean and maintained as expected for a hotel of this category. The service and amenties are also very average.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sportingtraveller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with a 3 month old baby and an 11 year old nephew on the way back to the UK from Florida. The hotel is ideally located 5-10 mins walk from the Boston Red Sox stadium at Fenway Park and its at the top of Newbury street with its good shops and restaurants, its a bit of a walk (15-20mins) to the "cirty centre" but then thats what exploring a city is all about. what I found unusual was that all of the staff were very friendly and accomodating and nothing was to much trouble and I would stay here again if I visit Boston, its unusual to have all off the staff so friendly and helpful and I could not fault them on anything. My only comment would be the room service is from the Restaurant attached to the hotel and it is quite expensive and you dont get alot for your money. You are much better going to the restuarnts 5 - 10 mins away down Newbury street.

Reviews.Title: “I always feel special at The Eliot.”
Reviews.Author: Martel1947
Reviews.Content: This beautiful boutique hotel gets it right every time, and is always improving the rooms and services. I had a new bathroom with a great shower, the usual two flat-screen tv's and cool technology on the TVs for activities, etc. An international staff and clientele keep it interesting and fun. Beautiful breakfast, excellent dinners at Clio.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean, classic chic”
Reviews.Author: otto60
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, old school, classic style. Location is on a nice apromenade, 10 min by car tot the center of Boston. Quite large room, beautiful classic granite bathroom. Valet parking will cost you 35 USD, but no other chance to get rid of the car. Internet available, but for 5 $. Friendly service. I was offered a 10$ discount on the breakfast but did not use it as I had to leave early. Restaurant looks very posh and elegant but I did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but some amenities surprisingly lacking”
Reviews.Author: ventureforth
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a "Splurge" hotel. Was pleased with the comfort of room and furnishings and layout like a small apartment (bathroom entered through hall rather than bedroom or sitting area). However, the computer did not work, nor did any internet connections using our own computer, and though each day we were told the problem would be fixed, it never was. A complimentary paper was available each day, but coffee was $4.00. Internet, had we been able to connect, would have been an extra charge. We weren't given clean glassware to use each day (disposables were not offered), so we did some germ sharing I'm sure. I just felt we were paying enough for the room to receive a few basics as part of the charge. Overall, I did like the place because it was quiet, clean, well located, and staff tried very hard to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Londonbound65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Eliot Hotel for 3 nights with our 2 children, ages 14 and 10. We had a corner suite (#504) which was very nice, spacious and clean. The bedroom had a kingsize bed which was extremely comfortable (more comfortable than our own bed). The ensuite bathroom was quite small, with a toilet, sink and shower, but beautifully appointed in marble, with Kohler fixtures and a Grohe shower which was very good. This is the only small criticism we would have of the suite - the size of the bathroom. Curtained French doors separated our bedroom from our children's room which was very spacious, had a queensize sofa bed, 2 big armchairs, a coffee table, an armoire housing a tv, and a desk with a touch-screen computer. There was also a foyer area with a minibar, sink and counter top. There is no coffee service in the room, however. Being tea drinkers, the hotel kindly lent us an electric kettle for the duration of our stay and we brought our own mugs and tea bags so we were able to enjoy a cuppa at any time. Service was second to none. We had a problem with the sound on our tv the first night, and after calling downstairs, someone was up to fix it within minutes. Housekeeping was excellent and very discreet. We enjoyed turndown service every night and toiletries were replenished as soon as we asked. We had to order room service one lunch time as our daughter was very sick and had to stay in. The food arrived within 20 minutes, piping hot and delicious. Just a note for anyone using room service: there is an 18% gratuity added automatically to the bill so don't tip twice. Another note regarding valet parking: the parking lot used by the hotel is a block and a half away so make sure to give the front desk plenty of notice (30-40 minutes) before you need your car. Special mention to Chris from England - fantastic, friendly service. Thank you Eliot Hotel - we will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: Haybailer22
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, a one bedroom suite. However, we got very tired of feeling as though we had to constantly tip everyone. The room was okay, bathroom a bit small with no exhaust fan...annoying. Very few wall plugs. And finally, VERY noisy heating system. Just 'okay' overall. Better choices in the Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Idontwant2gohome
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (with 2 teenage boys) stayed at the Eliot Hotel for a long weekend in February 2011. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite (one bedroom with a king and bath, a living room, and one room with two double beds with a bath) on the fourth floor which fit us perfectly. Staying at the Eliot was a great experience for our "resort" children. We were actually given keys to our rooms, not a plastic card! The historic charm of the building, lobby, elevators, and rooms where just perfect. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. While the marble bathrooms were small, they were perfectly adequate and cozy. Everything was clean and nicely appointed. We enjoyed the living room space enough to decide to stay in to watch the Super Bowl! The location was perfect. Shopping on Newbury street is just around the corner. Wireless is available on the touch screen computer in each room, but we did need to pay for wireless on our laptops-boys had to do a bit if homework during our stay. We were completely pleased with our stay, so much so that when we come back to Boston, we will be sure to stay at the Eliot!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, fabulous location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: woodenbowl
Reviews.Content: At the end of January 2011 my wife and I spent a week in a corner suite (room 808). I'm fortunate enough to have stayed at top hotels all around the world, and the service at the Eliot is second-to-none. It reminds me of the Huntington Hotel in San Francisco, another favorite small hotel. The location is perfect. Right next to Newbury Street and you can walk everywhere. Being one block from the Mass Turnpike entrance is convenient if you have appointments out of town. Our room was elegantly decorated and very comfortable. The bed is great. The bathroom is not big but adequate and everything works well. We had a giant walk-in closet. On the 8th floor there is a view to the South as well as a view of Mass Ave to the East - though I wouldn't call either view a major selling point for this room, it's nice to have. The service was superb. The gentleman at the front desk knew us by name by the 2nd day and would have our keys waiting for us whenever we walked in. We had some tea bags with us and my wife called down to ask if the hotel could send up a hot-water boiler. They didn't have one, so they sent a valet out to buy one and bring it up to the room for us, at no charge. Housekeeping was extremely friendly. The breakfast is not included but is reasonably priced for a hotel of this caliber. The buffet was a bit small but the Ã  la carte options are good. The eggs were really great. Some quibbles: Internet costs $5/day. It's a shame that there is a charge but this is a reasonable cost. The heating is a little bit finicky but was fine once we learned to use it. It can take 40 minutes to get your car out of valet which means you have to plan ahead. The lobby is unassuming, but in this type of hotel I consider that an advantage.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Gugi9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night but will be back again. The Eliot is a lovely, small, classic hotel with spacious suite-type rooms. The living room area was comfortable, cozy, well furnished and warm. The bedroom is separated by attractive french doors and has a king-size bed, marble bath, and everything was spic and span. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Back Bay location is great. If it wasn't for a raging snowstorm we'd have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at a great rate, smack in the heart of Boston.”
Reviews.Author: RincenaTravel
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful. I actually got the place on hotwire. It was gorgeous, clean and closer to five stars than it's 4 star rating. My room was a two room suite with a computer, two flat screen tv's, live plants, wireless for a fee, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. It is a great place

Reviews.Title: “utterly delightful, boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: arbd
Reviews.Content: This was such a wonderful surprise for my wife and me. We have stayed in about 25 different hotels in Boston over the years, inlcuding places like The Four Seasons. The Eliot is just the best of them all. The rooms feel like you are in a comfortable home. The staff beds over backwards trying to fulfill your every need. It is quiet but in a superb location right on Comm Ave in Boston, within walking distance to everything. I not only couldn't recommend this hotel any more highly but my wife and I will return here from now on with every visit we make to Boston. Nice job and thanks for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold room - and no good reason why."”
Reviews.Author: Pat711
Reviews.Content: The Eliot is old and charming and we paid $200 for the room, the night after Christmas. When we walked in our room, fresh from the blizzard outside, it was as cold as if the air conditioning had been on. We turned up the heat, but soon cold air was coming out of the air vents again. It was late and I couldn't imagine changing rooms so I slept with a heavy sweater. In the morning, my husband, who normally loves sleeping in a cool room, called the front desk to say HE was freezing. We tried the various things the hotel employee suggested, to no avail. The bathroom was worse; no air vents at all and all marble. Like an icebox. Bottom line is, I think, the walls of this charming old hotel have no insulation and the air vents are way up on the walls, near the ceiling. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: WestHartford_CTDal
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Eliot since the Junior Suites foldout sofa was the perfect solution for my sister-in-law's family of 3. The prices of the Junior Suites are as good or better than standard rooms nearby. This is a small hotel, but there are two adjoining restaurants and a nice bar, so you have most of the amenities of the big chain hotels. Service was just fantastic. Each room has a large touch-screen HP computer on the desk, which is a very nice touch. We passed on the pricey breakfast, but we did order up a pot of coffee that was delivered very quickly, and was delicious and very reasonably priced. Beds were very comfortable, with down pillows and a down comforter. The location is great for getting to Symphony Hall, MIT, and the Hynes Convention Center, but just a touch out of the way of the other Boston attractions, if you're walking. A great stay and a great value

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not quite great”
Reviews.Author: calebindiana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eliot before and chose it because I knew my family would like it. We got in late on a Thursday and stayed til Sunday morning. There are many things to like about this hotel, but a few to dislike also. Positive: 1) This is a really good Back Bay location. Close to Newbury St, Prudential Center, MIT, Berklee College of Music, Fenway. 2) Hotel honors any deal you can find on any site like Orbitz or Hotels.com. This means you can get that price but with the hotel's own, more liberal, cancellation policy. In this case, I got a room for $165. Just call and specify the better rate you are looking at. 3) Staff is very helpful and pleasant. Really this was true across the board. 4) They upgraded us from a double-double to a small suite with double-double but also a living room on the other side of french doors, plus a small additional room with sink and mini-bar. So at the price, this is a very nice hotel. Negative: 1) Like lots of old hotels, their heating system is finicky. Thursday night we had no heat at all, but didn't realize it til we woke up and it was 63 in the room. After three different visits from staff we got this fixed, but we still had to fiddle with the thermostat to get the compressor to kick on on another occasion. 2) Also took 3 visits from staff to get the internet right. They have cool touch-screens with FREE internet. But it failed on many tries before they got someone in there who could make it work. Once it did, it was great. And if you want internet on your own computer, it's fast and only $5 per day. They gave us a coupon for free internet on that too because of the trouble. 3) The restaurants are quite expensive. This is not necessarily a liability, but be aware. Thursday night we wanted a snack. We each had one order of (truly excellent ) sashimi with about 4 good bites of fish each. I had a beer and my wife had a moderate priced glass of wine and my daughter had a soft drink. $100 with tip. If they give you a coupon for $10 off the Continental breakfast buffet, it is good value at $10. Heck, a cup of coffee and a glass of juice a la carte would cost nearly as much. But I wouldn't pay $20 without the coupon for the cold buffet. On the whole, I'd probably stay at the Eliot again. It is a lovely hotel and the staff is very friendly and professional. Still, it has some "old hotel" problems worth noting when you compare it to the $95 price you might get on the Sheraton or Hilton or Westin nearby using Hotwire or Priceline. If you like older boutique hotels, you'll probably still prefer the Eliot even for the extra money. I'm told the Colonnade and Lenox are good hotels to compare but I have not been to either.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: FrancesEugenia
Reviews.Content: I love the Eliot Hotel. It is refined yet cozy, and not over the top. There is a subtle elegance to the space. The staff is friendly, prompt and discreet (a personal requirement). The location is prime, close to restaurants and shops. I do not like Boston but I am very pleased to have the Eliot when I am there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AussieHA
Reviews.Content: Is well located for tourist, including by vehicle (but watch out for street cleaning day if parking!). Our "quiet" rooms (709 & 909) were pleasant but "tight" and only quiet with the air conditioning off - so noisy we kept it off until absolutely required, not comfortable! Breakfast good value, doormen most helpful and welcoming, pity reception didn't attend same training school. Business people may want the "ishy" bit, but was more than necessary to feel comfortable. Next stay will be elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston with Wife, daughter and dog to look at colleges. This is a pet friendly hotel. The Eliot is on the corner of Commonwealth and Massachusetts Avenues. If you like shopping, half a block away is Newbury Street. We stayed on the forth floor in a suite-no road noise and had two restful nights of sleep. The fitness center is a sports club on Newbury Street (1 min. from Hotel) and free of charge with pass from front desk. If your lucky, you may find street parking but recommend the valet parking. This in an upscale property that is very well done. The hotel staff was very professional and attentive. I have no complaints and when we return to Boston we will stay at the Eliot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Great Location. A couple of caveats”
Reviews.Author: Tom2002a
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are accurate - this is a great hotel in a wonderful location. We have stayed twice and will be back. We are a family and the 2 room suites with 2 TV's fit our needs. The CAVEATS (things you might want to know, not necessarily complaints): PARKING you need valet park and depending on how busy it is you may not be able to pull right up in front -- that's ok just pull around the corner which is also a valet loading zone controlled by the hotel. As this is Boston, there is always bumper to bumper traffic around the hotel and you'll need be patient. SMALL BATHROOMS - see photo. These are clean, well appointed but tight. OTHER - no in room coffee, charge for the Sunday paper and no ice machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Girl's weekend”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eliot Hotel last weekend with my girlfriends and had a great time. The hotel was well appointed, clean and bug free (very important these days). The four of us had 2 suites which worked out well for hanging out and catching up with our lives. The staff was professional and very helpful with restaurant, tours and entertainment suggestions. Since it is a very small boutique hotel, it was not crowded at all. The only negative things about the hotel are - the large brass room key is very cumbersome to carry around, there is no coffee pot in the room and the safe is on the top shelf of the closet. Other than that it was a perfect place to stay for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, super location, super staff”
Reviews.Author: Ralff
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. On booking asked for a top floor and quiet room. When we arrived, top floor and very quiet room. Front desk and porter service are outstanding - helpful and friendly. Turn down service at night. Room was a two room suite with plasma TV's. Bathroom amenities were top flight. Elevators are 30's style and very fitting for the hotel. Valet parking is expensive at $35, but beats a ticket, and the car was ready when we asked. If you are leaving before 7 am, remember to ask the font desk to have your car out front as the garage closes between 1 am and 7 am. One block walk to Newbury street. Loads of restaurants bars and shopping within a 2 minute walk. We received coupons for 15% off of dinner at Clio and then $10 each day for breakfast. However, the breakfast for just bagels, fruit, yogurt etc is $20 ($10 with coupon) is expensive so we chose eat breakfast elsewhere. If you need your am caffeine, there is no coffee maker in the room. All in all we had an enjoyable stay and the hotel delivered what we asked for, and that is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card statement carefully ...”
Reviews.Author: patriciacarlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night. Booked the hotel through Expedia and paid for the room through Expedia. When I checked into the hotel - they asked for a credit card for miscellaneous charges -- pretty standard operating procedure. When I checked out of the hotel, the front desk indicated that since I hadn't incurred any additional expenses, there was no real need to print out a bill. I foolishly said ok. 1 week later -- checking my credit card statement -- noticed a $36 charge from the hotel above and beyond the room fee. Called the hotel and they said the charge was for valet parking -- which was a bit odd since I didn't have a car. Asked to have the charge removed immediately. Transferred to "accounting" where I received someone's voicemail. Hung up and called the hotel back -- they tried to transfer me to accounting again -- told them "no way", just remove the charge. They then told me that they had to verify that I hadn't had a car valet parked. I told them that there wasn't anything to verify because I didn't have a car in Boston and that I wanted the charge reversed immediately. To me, this is all paramount to fraud -- I'm sure plenty of people don't scrutinize their credit card bills -- nice way for the hotel to make some extra money. The room was nice, bathroom small but okay -- the hallways were pretty shabby (frayed rugs, marks on the wall).

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient location but a tad overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: JGab76
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is very conveniently located among the brownstones in beautiful Back Bay. One mile to Public Garden & Boston Common. Easy walk to Copley Plaza and the shopping on Newbury. One block walk to subway stop for easy access to the whole city. Here is something to keep in mind when booking the room however: Not all of the rooms are suites - a few are just rooms and quite small. We didn't realize we had booked one of these, and were socked how small the room was. When I expressed disappointment to the front desk, they immediately upgraded us to a suite. For what we paid it was worth it, but I would have thought it very overpriced if we had paid the full suite rate. The great attitude of the hotel manager in upgrading us is indicative of the overall great service. Other good perks: Free wireless internet and access to Boston Sports Club one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite for traveling with kids in downtown Boston!”
Reviews.Author: annieket
Reviews.Content: Finding a suite for 2 adults, 2 kids and a baby in downtown Boston seemed to be a challenge. We were very happy when we found the Eliot for a decent rate in the middle of the summer. The hotel has great rooms, nicely decorated (chic, modern but not hip feel), good international staff and a upscale restaurant downstairs. It is 100 yards from Newburry Street, the upscale shopping area of Boston. The hotel does not have a lobby (just some chairs next to the reception), no bar, gym etc. However this was not missed. If offered for the same rate (around 275) would definitely be back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep I've had all summer.”
Reviews.Author: Cariblu
Reviews.Content: Attentive from the bellman to the room service. Delightful, small elegant suite hotel. Lovely bar/restaurant called Clio. Front desk very professional. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeGirl50
Reviews.Content: I've been to Boston many times, but this was my first stay at the Eliot Hotel, and hopefully, I'll be able to stay here on all future visits! The hotel is a historic building and has that old-world charm, which carries through to the way they treat their guests. The service was absolutely top-notch; everyone we met, from the bell staff to the front desk to the restaurant staff, was the best!! You simply don't find people like this at the average hotel, or any other place, for that matter! We had a beautiful suite, with two double beds, and a full-sized living room. The bathroom was tiny (that's the historic part coming through) but elegantly appointed, and there's another sink in the foyer. We were entitled to the breakfast buffet and it was excellent. And the location of the hotel is so convenient: Newbury and Boylston Streets, and the T within a block. Many thanks to all the wonderful people we met at the Eliot Hotel and Clio Restaurant. You made this a favorite trip for my family and me!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at Eliot”
Reviews.Author: CruisingAgain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eliot from July 28th through August 1st while visiting our daughter who attends college there. We had a one room suite. After reading prior reviews about service, I was somewhat concerned. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless and the staff was courteous and friendly at all times. We were greeted every time we came in to the hotel or left (which was quite a bit!). No matter how busy the staff was, they always said hello and asked if we needed anything. The location was great, walking distance to shops on Newberry Street and even Fenway. Pricey- but it is nice to be pampered once in a while!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Eliot”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very nice weekend in Boston with the family (wife and one out of two kids). Stayed in a suite at the Eliot that was wonderful. Very nice room for my wife and me, with french doors making our room private from our son on the sleeper sofa (whihc he said was very comfortable). The service was fantastic. The belhops, front desk, maids, everyone were very attentive and helpful. Our room was perfect, with a great touchscreen computer, cookies upon arrival, chocolates before bed. The roomwas all we could have wished for except: shower was so-so, fan did not work in the bathroom and the blinds would not shut all the way so that the sun came in right at daybreak. I view those as minor inconveniences for a great stay. The Eliot is very convenient to Fenway, Boylston, Newbury and the Prudential center, and a quick T-line trip to anywhere else. I recommend this hotel for anyone (except maybe disabled persons due to a downstaits lobby and small elevators)..
