We had a special rate of $299 which included overnight valet parking ($36 savings) on a very busy streets (so the valet is key) and baked goods breakfast buffet for two ($40 savings). We had a great steak dinner at Abe and Louie's and great seafood at Legal Seafood. Shopped and took our son to the Aquairium and Science Museum (get your tickets on line to avoid the huge lines!!!). Great overall stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: RiceAndBeansVintage
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a night at the Eliot with our 4 year old son. We had a one bedroom suite which was lovely, comfortable,luxe, and very clean. We were in town for a concert and the room was the perfect size for a family of 3 plus a babysitter. Everyone was very nice and helpful and the hotel is in a fantastic location. We will be back. The only thing I didn't like was that you have to pay for wireless unless you use the computer in the room. However the computer they provide is a touch screen which makes it impossible to do actual work. Otherwise the best.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina70
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 young children and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The hotel is very well located - at the end of Newbury St, on Commonwealth Ave. We happened to arrive on the 4th of July and could see the fireworks from our room. It is very difficult to find beautiful accommodation that works with children, but the Eliot was perfect. We had a very spacious suite with a nice size bedroom with King size bed, and a comfortable fold out couch in the living room and then an interconnecting room with 2 queen sized beds. The decor is gorgeous, with silk curtains and full marble bathrooms. I always assume that a hotel is never as nice as the official photos, but The Eliot rooms are every bit as lovely as it appear on the website. The entry lobby is marble with chandeliers, flowers and artwork. The bathroom products were really lovely. There was a small butlers pantry in the suite, with a sink and the mini bar. I noticed another review commented on not being able to find ice - we found ice was brought with the turn down service. The only thing I would perhaps like to have seen was a larger fridge and tea and coffee making facilities, but these are minor concerns and would not put me off staying again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great, but beware of hidden parking costs...”
Reviews.Author: Langrila
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this lovely boutique hotel. Had a great view from our adorable room with French toile accents on a higher floor. But when we checked out we found $56 dollars worth of parking charges for our rental car that no one had informed us about! When we asked the woman at the front desk about it, she didn't even apologize for the misunderstanding, let alone offer to wipe the charge from our bill. I am happy to pay for great service when I know about it in advance, but don't appreciate hidden, sneaky charges. The staff was very helpful when we checked in, but less so when we checked out. It's unfortunate, because we had a nice stay there, but we left with a bad taste in our mouths. I would recommend the hotel, but would also recommend taking a cab!

Reviews.Title: “The more you pay the less that's complimentary”
Reviews.Author: MAKHighland_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and lovely and expensive and charming. The service was OK and the room looked nice but the air conditioning did not work well and every little thing costs extra....there is not even an ice machine, which means you have to tip the fellow who brings you that one, small bucket of ice. The bathroom was very small and, although everyone in our party had a small suite, each room was different and came with different things (like some got a breakfast voucher and some didn't, even after asking). The door men were very friendly and help, the front desk not-so-much. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: bklynKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eliot while attending a conference at the Hynes Convention Center. Eliot is close enough to the Hynes that I had no problem coming back to the hotel to change or drop off items in between sessions. The staff was amazing, from the moment my cab pulled up, I was greeted and assisted with my luggage. I was welcomed by everyone, and the staff made it a point to remember me throughout my visit. The rooms are very comfortable, a good amount of space, and nicely furnished. My only criticism is that the beds could have been a bit more comfortable. I found the bed to be a little too firm. Fortunately there were plenty of pillows that helped to make up for it. I didn't want to leave! I felt so pampered and comfortable, even while on a business trip! Besides the Hynes, the hotel is near Newberry St, Cambridge, and a T stop. Near the Hynes center is a Trader Joe's and a Shaw's for those times you get sick of convention food!

Reviews.Title: “When there's a problem ... good luck”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: While the accommodations are fine, the service is what one finds at a Ramada Inn. I encountered several problems, including a billing issue. To a person, the staff's approach was consistently "we're very sorry." PERIOD. No accountability, no solving the problem, no "we need to address this." The unspoken statement was, "So what do you want ME to do?" I stay in Boston 2 times/month and wanted to accommodate a client who suggested the Eliot. What a mistake. I typically stay at the Four Seasons (outstanding) or the Taj (old Ritz) or the Ritz. I knew all of them were good, but having now experienced the Eliot, I am freshly aware HOW good they are. Stay anywhere else. You'll be disappointed by the Eliot.

Reviews.Title: “eliot makes things right”
Reviews.Author: ackamw
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Yes, there were some problems as mentioned in other reviews, but the front desk was terrific, quick to respond, upgraded me to a better room. Makes me wonder if other negative reviews were because mgt wasn't notified of the problems.Friendly, attentive service, great location. You are better off ordering off the menu for breakfast rather than doing the buffet. My favorite hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint even though it's in the city!”
Reviews.Author: SmokyFaerie
Reviews.Content: This was a bit of a splurge for me but well worth it! I would definitely stay again but for only a short time since it was a bit expensive. The staff was phenomenal! I was very worried about parking since I drove around for 15 minutes and didn't see anything. As a last resort, I drove right up to the hotel and they had someone right there to take care of everything. I can't remember if I paid anything for the parking but it wasn't unreasonable. I didn't have to worry about a thing after that was eagerly taken care of for me. The hotel was beautiful and luxurious. The elevators and hallways were small but gorgeous. We were greeted by the friendly staff and taken to our room expeditiously. The room was a nice size and had a perfectly clean, decent sized closet. The bed was very comfortable and there were chocolates and cookies left nearby for us to indulge in. They were quite good too! The bathroom was awesome. The shower was huge and the entire bathroom was immaculate. The decor was very romantic and there was just the right amount of furniture in the room. It was cozy. I wish I lived there! When we were ready to go out, it was such a pleasure! The neighborhood is safe and so beautiful. Great place for a romantic walk at night. There was a park nearby and the houses/buildings were wonderful to take in. There were also plenty of restaurants and shops nearby (within walking distance) to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bostonjames
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three times during 2007, 2008 and 2009. I was in Boston for medical reasons. Stayed for up to three weeks at a time. The hotel staff was outstanding. Whenever a upgrade was available, they always provided us one at no cost. Room service was fast and helpful. Ceio is the best resturant in the area but expensive. The upper rooms on the inside are preferred Each time we returned they asked how I was feeling. Duringa Oct visit I asked if is was possibe to get a Red Sox ticket for the first game of the playoffs. They found a friend that let us have then for less than the going $$$$ Weather left a little to be desired during the months of Jan and Feb.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon'sfriend
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night in December. The room was lovely. Well laid out, extremely well appointed and charming. The hotel has a unique feel and exudes luxury. There were a few issues: some small peeling in one corner of the ceiling, subtle spots on some of the furniture in the sitting room, a scratched toilet lid, and a odd-smelling blanket in the closet. But these things did not at all impair my experience and were vastly overshadowed by the beauty and attention to detail. Overall it was lovely, though I found that the guy at the front desk (who had a charming British accent) didn't seem big on protocol. He spent an inordinate amount of time chatting up a patron about local pubs while at least three others stood in line waiting to check in. All in all, lovely, with a few minor impairments.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality at every point of service”
Reviews.Author: Drattlo
Reviews.Content: At this price point there are better alternatives for the money in Boston. The basic problem is that they have students from the area universities who are better behind a computer than delivering services in a hotel situation. It starts with breakfast where the waiters (i.e., students) fail to service tables in a timely manner. It took twenty minutes ( and four waiters) to obtain a piece of toast that should have come with my meal. Also, there are no papers available in the hotel on the weekend. Should you want one, you will be directed to a paper box two blocks away. So bring some change with you. Even though the room were remodeled recently, they are not maintained well. The front desk service was poorer than that in the restaurant. I observed a number of people attempting to remove incorrect charges from their credit card to no avail. Errors in billing appeared on my card a month later. The Head Concierge was condescending when asked to address an issue that one of the student front desk employees made. If you want to enjoy your trip to Boston, stay any place but the The Eliot on Commonwealth Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb room in a superb european feeling hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaRealtor
Reviews.Content: Spent the labour day weekend in the penthouse suite and loved every moment of it.th furnishings were elegant,the views very nice and the staff bent over backwards to help us.Sure, the bathroom was on the small size,but how much time does one spend there?Very good value even when converting from the weaker Canadian dollar. Compares favourably with major four and five star hotels of Europe and North America that we hace frequented!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again -- there are better hotels in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel really missed a chance to raise its game when it was refurbished. They should have tried everything to make the bathrooms larger and to spring for much nicer fixtures. (The toilet, in particular, is unacceptable, and whoever did the grouting should be sued.) Instead they ended up with rooms that are decently sized and furnished, but with very, very tight bathrooms. Any pretense at luxury ended there for me. The safe in my room didn't work, and neither of the two phones could be used to call reception. On one phone, I could hear the person on the other end but they couldn't hear me, and the other phone had no connection to reception whatsoever. One morning, I went into the shower only to discover that housekeeping hadn't left any shampoo. (They made a mistake and left two shower gels instead.) So I came out of the shower, tried to call reception -- and couldn't. I finally resorted to using my cell phone. That has never happened to me before in any hotel I've ever stayed in. There's a "high tech" terminal where you can view your bill, order things for the room, order room service, etc. I arranged for a wake-up call, but then changed my mind about the time. Unfortunately, there was no way to change the time once it's been programmed in. And -- you guessed it -- I couldn't call reception. So I had to go downstairs to tell them in person to change my wake-up call time! I got a coupon for a half-priced continental breakfast -- $10 instead of the usual extortionate price of $20. But I'm not sure this was a bargain at all. The breakfast consisted of stale croissants and bread, poor coffee . . . frankly, I preferred going to Starbuck's on Newbury Street. W-fi- is available, but at a cost of about $10 a day. Why do hotels even charge for this service anymore, when so many of the trendy new hotels provide it for free? If you don't want to pay this, the Trident Book Store on Newbury Street has a cafe with free wi-fi. Anyway, you get the idea. Too many things botched, and not enough of a feeling of high-end luxury. The area is nice, although be aware that it's on the far end of Back Bay and a bit of a walk to the Public Gardens and Commons. There's a T-stop close by, and the Hynes Convention Center is just down the street. The Prudential Center isn't far either. Upon check out, I listed all of the things that had gone wrong. The clerk was apologetic and expressed the hope that I would stay there again. Not likely; there are many better hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Eliot, but one caution”
Reviews.Author: giventime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eliot Hotel for a 3 night vacation. I was all ready to run home and give it a 5 star review (it was that nice), until check out time. Our bill had charges totaling $100 that we did not make, like parking (we had no vehicle) and mini bar charges that were not ours. Make sure to check your bill carefully - you can do this conveniently on the in-room system. Our room was just as described and pictured. We stayed in room 504, a suite with a king size bed. We asked for a quiet room and we really did get one. Virtually no neighbor noise and muffled street noise only. The bathroom was pretty tight quarters for my 6' 4" husband, but it was clean and the toiletries they supply are really nice. The location is great for sightseeing, the hotel is a little over a block from the "T" station, plus there are shops and restaurants nearby. Just up the street next to Bank of America, try "Spikes" for lunch - the Ranger burger is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: budahhfly
Reviews.Content: The room was very small; however the furnishings were very nice. The bathroom was large and very elegant, but the commode was straight out of a public bathroom. (weird) The staff was friendly. The location was great. In between Back Bay and Fenway/Kenmore. Two blocks from the Charles River. Was perfect for a morning run. They even provided a joggers map. That was great! It was a fine for one night. Be careful of getting loud nieghbors. The walls are thin and you can hear every word if your neighbors are speaking loudly. Plumbing is kinda loud too. Paid well over $200 for the bottom of the line room. Booked it on Expedia. Expected it to be a lot nicer for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the eliot”
Reviews.Author: gabby
Reviews.Content: just back from a week at the eliot and had a great stay ! the entrance is more like entering a private home that a hotel , and is elegant , but comfortable . our room as a large twin , with 2 double beds , there was a large flat screen tv as well as 2 armchairs and a table . the only slight disapointment was that the bathroom was small , compared to the rest of the room , and definatly need more shelf space , but was clean and well stocked with towels and toiletries . there was an in-room safe for valubles . we tried room service for both breakfast and dinner and while the meals were loverly they were expensive and despite the hotel having 2 resturants the choice was quite limited . however for breakast there are several choices near by , including mcdonalds and dunnkin donuts for a quick start to the day , within about 5 mins as well as a supermarket who do very nice rolls ! ( another must is to try 'sweet' for the most gorgeous cakes ! ) the big inovation this hotel has is the touch screen system which was installed in our room during our stay . it allows the ordering and pre ordering of meals , wake up calls and also extra toileties as needed , as well as information on transport , local attractions etc this is a great hotel in a very nice area , close to major shopping areas like the prudential cetre and newbery avenue . it is quite a long walk to the harbour , at least 1 hour , it's about half an hour to the public gardens and the cheers bar ( another must ! ) but there is a t subway station just around the corner and the system is easy to use and with a charlie card only $1:70 a trip . one thing we did find was that this is one of the most freindly cities you could wish to visit , we initially found the subway a bit confusing , but people could not have been more helpfull boston is a great city , with lot's to see and do and the eliot is a great base for any trip !

Reviews.Title: “hotel so dusty -checked out”
Reviews.Author: coco6gracie2
Reviews.Content: We thought we had picked a good hotel but the hotel fwelt old and very dusty like being in someones attic. We checked out. I would no encourage others to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nance619
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in Boston with three friends. We wanted to be near Fenway for the Paul McCartney concert. I had stayed at the Back Bay Hilton a number of years ago and found my experience there unpleasant. So I researched the hotels in the area by price and rating. A stay at the Eliot turned out to cost $9 more than a stay at the Hilton which would have given us a small room with two double beds and a cot. At the Eliot we had a suite with two queen sized beds and another queen in a pull out couch. The rooms were spacious, clean and lovely. There was turn-down service at night, a friendly welcoming staff, and included in our package was free parking and baker's breakfast for two. We plan to return to the Eliot soon and enjoy more of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: The Eliot hotel has one of the best locations in Boston - you can walk to Fenway in one direction, Newbury street in the other, and even the park along the Charles river is only a few minutes in yet another direction. The T station is one block away for anything further afield. Don't miss ice cream at JP Licks on Newbury street, about 3 minutes walk from the hotel! The rooms are almost all suites - and ours had a very comfortable layout for a family with a baby. The suites do range significantly in size, so if you have a bigger family, ask for one of the bigger rooms. Although the front lobby is small it feels very classy - much like the entrance to a classy residential apartment building. The restaurants in the hotel looked like they had great dinners but we didn't get a chance to try them - just breakfast. And I agree with the other reviews - breakfast needs some work. They really should just make the buffet included in the price of the room - and if not, then at least add some eggs made to order to the buffet. Right now, even with their 10 dollar off vouchers, it just doesn' t make sense to eat there. Just head down Newbury street to the bookstore cafe on the right side for a great breakfast at the same price! The front desk service was very pleasant but did not wow me. The best service came from the doormen, who always welcomed us home with a smile and helped with the stroller. Value is very good if you can get a weekend rate - not as good if you have to pay full price, but still comparable to other hotel's two room suites.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: emconstruction
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often for business and have not been able to duplicate this wonderful hotel. The suite are the perfect size for working after hours in a very calming environment. The service and staff are beyond reproach and always ready to help. The general attitude reflects the positive approach management takes and it can be seen at every level. I enjoy coming back to my home away from home. Let us not forget both restaurants which are a treat to my stays as well. I would never consider staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Cozy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGal50
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel with a touch of European charm. Withing walking distance of the T and great restaurants. The staff from the doorman, front desk to housekeeping were friendly and helpful. Room was well appointed but could use a little updating. More counter space needed in the bathroom with better lighting and a coffee maker would have been welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: NEFBoston
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay at the famed Eliot Hotel in Boston, and we could not have been more disappointed. First, I will never book a room online again b/c I feel when properties see you've booked online, they treat you like a second class citizen. We had requested early check in of only 1 hour before (we had an event to get ready for), and we were denied this request each time we made it (I had called the hotel 1 month prior, was told to call back the morning of our rez, did so, was told they MAY be able to accommodate us when we got there, and no they could not check us in early once we arrived.) I suspect the hotel will not accommodate early check-in request b/c once you see the tiny, no view, dirty room, you'll want to move. Which brings me to the room itself. The bathroom was not clean. There were feces on the wall next to the toilet paper dispenser and on the underside of the toilet bowl. There is no reasonable explanation for this; it was disgusting. The shower walls were loaded with soap scum as well and the floor in the bathroom was not clean. Never again will we stay at the Eliot.

Reviews.Title: “At Home Again”
Reviews.Author: MarkWorcesterMA
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Eliot quite frequently, but had not traveled to Boston for some time until returning for a recent visit. Despite my long absence, the staff immediately greeted me by name when I arrived and throughout my stay. Room service food was spectacular and the waitress who brought it up to me was warm and courteous. As always, the room was clean, comfortable, and had a great view. This hotel never fails to make me feel at home each time I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service from a Plain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenC-NYC
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a stay at the Eliot Hotel and this place, in particular the restaurant, is a rip off. Apparently, in the restaurant's system Hash Browns = Eggs Benedict, and when you tell them you did not order Eggs Benedict they refuse to remove it from the bill. Also, the "buffet" breakfast has less items than a continental breakfast. Everything else about the hotel including the rooms, bed, bathroom, lobby is merely standard. Oh and the heat in the hotel does not work for more than a few minutes at a time. You have to stay under the covers to keep warm. Not what one would expect from a boutique hotel. Save your self the hassle and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: whsieh
Reviews.Content: As a former resident of Boston, I'm always looking for a place to stay when returning to my hometown. The Eliot is my hotel of choice. It is my home away from home. Its Back Bay location is extremely convenient for access to the city: whether its spending the day at the Common, visiting the waterfront, catching a Red Sox game at Fenway or shopping on Newbury Street. The rooms are spacious yet cozy and the staff is incredibly helpful and welcoming. Whenever I'm asked to recommend a place to stay in Boston, the Eliot Hotel is my number one choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: mbrousseau
Reviews.Content: I love Boston. It's one of my favorite cities in the US, and whenever I travel there I look forward to a fabulous stay at the Eliot Hotel. The hotel has a certain charm perfect for historical Boston and seriously lacking in most big chain hotels. It's location is the best in the city. I love leaving in the early morning to do some shopping on Newbury Street and then at night, there are dozens of excellent restaurants easily within walking distance. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and always willing to help you. The rooms are comfortable and private. The Eliot is the only place I'll ever stay when I visit Boston, and I can't wait to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “I will be coming back to the Eliot, again and again.”
Reviews.Author: ptaveira
Reviews.Content: My family, some friends, and I had a great time staying at the Eliot Hotel. It's location in the Back Bay was perfect in allowing us to successfully celebrate my wife's birthday. From the shopping and pampering on Newbury Street to the dinner and nightlife in the Kemore Square and Fenway Park/Lansdowne Street areas, everything was a convenient walk away. We enjoyed a great Sunday breakfast at the hotel's adjacent Clio restaurant. And as one of the top 5 restaurants in Boston, it's not cheap, but the food is top-notch, professionally staffed, and the restaurant is well-respect and well-rated. The hotel itself is classic Bostonian and was clean and well-appointed. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful and made us feel right at home. I'm looking for an excuse to go back into the Boston as soon as possible, and when I do, I'll be staying at the Eliot yet again (and again).

Reviews.Title: “So Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: city44
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue, but definitely wanted to send my raves about the Eliot Hotel. The location is in a perfect spot in the Back Bay area of Boston, which in my opinion is the best place to stay especially if you plan on going to a Red Sox game...it's not very far to walk. The hotel rooms are spacious, very comfortable and have a historic feel. The staff is exceptionally helpful. There's a seafood restaurant on the Waterfront in South Boston called "No Name" because there's no name on the entrance...you either know about it or you don't. At that time, it was difficult to find the exact location. The front desk was relentless in their search and finally printed out a map for us pinpointing exactly where it was. It's an older hotel, so there's a need for forgiveness for smaller, older elevators that don't move as fast as were accustomed to at our workplace. The hotel is generally quiet and housekeeping very much respects your sleep time. The views are very nice. Shopping on Newbury St. is close by as well. I've stayed at a few hotels in Boston, but this is the one I would return to without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: kumar06
Reviews.Content: This is far the best hotel in Boston. One of my biggest peeves is the hotel trend towards cold, modern small boutique hotel with personalized service. The Eliot hotel has retained its individualism and offers luxury, made my stay in Boston EXTRA SPECIAL. The location can not be beat, and the Clio and Uni restaurant is fantastic dining place, great staff. Check in was very smooth. They gave us a complimentary upgrade. The suite was awesome. The hotel staff was fantastic, professional and always willing to anticipate guest's needs. My only other regret is that we did not have so much time to take advantage of any of the great facilities the hotel dag to offer. i am looking forward to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper2202
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple spent last Saturday night at the Eliot. We were greeted warmly by the front desk staff. Without even asking, we were upgraded to a beautiful 1 bedroom suite. It had all the amenities - king bed, flat screen tv, bar area, lovely sitting room. The view was of an alley but we did not mind. The room was quiet and soothing. The linens very soft and luxurious. That evening we ate at Clio, a fantastic dining experience not only for the delicious food but also the wait staff - truly exceptional. We were given coupons for breakfast buffet but it seemed unremarkable so we ordered off the menu. It was good but not great and the service was so-so. The staff of the hotel are very accommodating and eager to please. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nycstella
Reviews.Content: The Eliot Hotel is a charming hotel with a great location. I've stayed there with my boyfriend several times in the last year, and had a great experience every time. I've stayed at several other Boston hotels -- all were more expensive and none were as good overall. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and elegant (tho some with better views than others) and it's right around the corner from Newbury Street, which has great shopping. The suites are spacious and most have a separate area with a wet bar. Room service has never disappointed! Some rooms could do with a minor upgrade to the temperature system and bathroom, but these details aren't enough to drop a star from my review. I love staying at this hotel and I wish I felt this at home in my own NYC apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews but Romantic anyway”
Reviews.Author: WebgoddessNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days and 2 nights at the Eliot and have mixed reviews. Chose the property both for the elegance for the romantic getaway we sought and for the fact they were a dog-friendly hotel. Had a King suite on the 7th floor, quiet and to the side of the building. Mini bar with sink, but no ability to use refrigerator for our own beverages or no microwave for leftovers. Bathroom was like a small closet, but this likely has to do with the fact it's an old building and they put what they could where they could. The suite was pretty, comfortable sitting area, separated from the bedroom with wide french doors. But the ventilation system was LOUD, and didn't cycle on and off as the setting should have. Drowned out the TV and made sleeping difficult. In addition the mattress reminded us of lying down on a piece of cardboard and the white comforter had a dinner-plate sized yellow (urine?) stain on it. Ii expected more from a "luxury" hotel. Got a decent rate, but for the price we still had to pay $10 internet access fee and lost the access for a better part of the day. Received breakfast vouchers of $10 each good toward the $20 "breakfast buffet". Having had the most marvelous, out of this world dinner at Clio the evening before, we were looking forward to breakfast there. What a disappointment. The staff was cold and rude and difficult to understand. The buffet had bagels with no way to warm/toast them, no juice -- we had to ask for it after waiting 5 minutes or better for someone to notice us, then the waiter only brought one juice, not two and never returned to fill any glass, including the water -- my husband had to seek him out for more water, forget the juice!! The buffet the menu makes out to sound decadent was nothing more than yogurt cups on ice, some chopped up fruit, cardboard individual serving boxes of cereal, some croissants and a couple muffins to accompany the cold bagels. Very sparse and very disappointing given the price of not only the breakfast "buffet" but the accommodations as well. (no where were the "fresh baked pastries" touted on the menu... we've stayed at Hampton Inns for less than $100 a night had a hot breakfast with protein/eggs, toaster to heat bagels/muffins, plenty of available juice and more. I can' t believe for the price they can't put out a chafing dish of at least scrambled eggs... ) With over an hour yet to serve, there were no clean plates set out to replace the stack that got used meaning the patrons had to take their dirty plates back up to the buffet. The impression we got was that we were annoying the staff and they really just wanted the people remaining to leave. My husband was disappointed in what he originally saw on the buffet and ordered breakfast off the menu, but for $33 plus tip, we walked away hungry and disappointed. We did not return on our second morning there. Sadly, if this had been our first exposure to Clio restaurant, we would have never gone in for dinner and would have missed the outstanding experience with the wonderful meal we did have the evening before. (I suspect the morning service at the restaurant has nothing to do with Clio itself, it's only a place to serve the morning meal, but if I was Clio's chef, I'd be pretty upset about the impression they give of my restaurant...) Valet parking is available and we were satisfied with the service. Desk personnel were told about breakfast problems but shrugged it off and didn't offer to make amends in any way. All in all, with exception of the breakfast staff, the other staff were nice and friendly. The experience was nice for the most part and it is a lovely building with elegant surroundings. We most likely would stay there again and make the Clio dining part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “About our wonderful stay at the Eliot Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MevrouwC
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Eliot hotel as a surprise for my mother, and this worked out very very well! The service we received was excellent and my mother was impressed by the lovely suite! Also the location is great because of the fact that the well-known Newbury and Boylston streets are within an one minute walk. We would definitely recommend this hotel, and we also will visit this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The Eliot A CLASS OF ITS OWN”
Reviews.Author: SCM10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose this hotel to celebrate his birthday weekend in the city. We expected something upscale and comfortable and we were not disappointed. We had the pleasure of staying in a spacious suite with views of Commonwealth Ave. From the luxurious duvets to the comfy pillows, To the flat screen TV's to the fully stock mini bar we could relax and feel like we were at home. More impressive was the remarkably friendly and efficient staff who were always present to greet us and to attend to our needs. Although there is no exercise room or spa they have an arrangement with a nearby health club. The location was great just steps from Newbury St and shopping at Copley Place. There is also a delightful breakfast for which we received discount coupons upon check in. Overall if you are looking for a romantic escape the Eliot Hotel is the perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni will make any other hotel I stay at pale in comparision”
Reviews.Author: Foof225
Reviews.Content: I am just getting around to typing my review of the Eliot Hotel, however it is due to the fact as I search for a hotel in a different area, I wish the Eliot had a sister franchise in other urban cities. The Eliot hotel is a true gem! It has a perfect location, close to all the major areas of town any visitor would need, especially shopping and the theater..Whether you need the subway or want a cab, it is all at your doorstep. More important than its location is the excellent service and room itself. My room was superior! I had a great view of the park(not sure of the name) from my window. Upon entry of my room, I was greeted with a welcome package. The cookies awaiting my party were outstanding! A friend had some champagne sent up and the manager on duty, Joseph, was gracious and caring. He actually brought the champagne to my room. I was very impressed by the hands on touch the management showed. The pillows were so dreamy I had to ask where I could find them, as I was in heaven. The bathroom was as big as the separate room in our suite. It was sparklingly clean. All in all, I can't recommend the Eliot enough. It is very hard to find something like it in say New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: shepsara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel over the Thanksgiving period. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a complimentary suite which was marvellous. The room was spacious, elegantly decorated and heaven to stay in. All the staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them - even when I lost my passport! The hotel is positioned in a great area of Boston with only a short walk to Newbury Street and Boylston street and a 10 minute walk to the Prudential centre. Great value for money - a hotel with a lot of "london" class!

Reviews.Title: “Questionable”
Reviews.Author: zeusnh
Reviews.Content: The staff/service was excellent. The cleanliness of the room was disgusting for a four star hotel or for any hotel tell for that matter. Would not take a shower because there were black foot prints in the tub, bathrobe was dirty (yellowed), soap dish has soap scum in it (inside shower), hand rail in show was soap scummed, mirror in hall way looked like someone flossed their teeth and it was never cleaned afterwards, half canopy over bed had 1/4 inch of dust on it (never touched), one remote didn't work, finger and hand prints on french door glass (all glass looked like it had never been cleaned) and the list goes on. Expect to pay a parking garage fee; parking is not included with the room!!!! $36 fee.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: LuvtoTravel88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 times. Great location, great space in suites, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, perfect position!”
Reviews.Author: Ali24
Reviews.Content: What a find!.. My husband and I and our two kids (14 and 11) stayed at the Eliot Hotel for 5 days during August while we explored Boston. We had a suite which was spacious, modern and very clean and the front of desk staff were so lovely and helpful, constantly looking up addresses of shops that my teen daughter wanted to visit and googling places we had been recommended. It was in a fantastic position at the top of Newbury Street where all the trendy shops and eateries were and had none of the hectic comings and going of a large hotel, infact it almost felt like a classy apartment block. Recommended and we are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “simple, good location”
Reviews.Author: a-2-z-traveler112254
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the elliot hotel ove rlabor day weekend. we were up graded to a sutie on the 9th level (top floor) b/c it was our anniversary. Which was nice! The location was great for shopping, the prudential center, and even to walk the freedom trail. The ugly.... this hotel is old. All night long even being in the 9th floor at we heard was traffic noise, sirens, horns blasting, ambulances, ect. we thought it would stop but it continued all night. i can't imagine how noisey it must be on lower levels. The bed was hard as a rock. (the worst i have ever slept on) and we had our AC on 65 degrees the entire time we were there but the room never got below 80. There are nicer hotels in this area for the money. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and overly accomedation, printed out mapquest directions for me to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged for room, not a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: rharris209
Reviews.Content: I just spent an entire week at the Eliot in Boston. Our son was attending a clinic at Berklee School of Music. The hotel was fair...bathroom was really small, older rooms but decent. The maid service could have done a lot better job.. My problem was that when we checked in (which was at about midnight after traveling for 12 hours) I wasn't sure what the rate for the room was supposed to be as my wife had made the reservation. So the next morning I noticed the rate was not correct so I checked on line and then went down to the desk. After discussing it with the desk person, at first he wasn't going to honor the rate. I told him it is advertised and that was supposed to be the rate we got. He finally agreed as he couldn't really take any other position. So, when I checked out I noticed that they had adjusted the rate for day 2 through 6. So I asked why the first night wasn't corrected and they said that I hadn't said anything till the next morning so they WOULD NOT correct it. I spent over $4000 that week at the Eliot, and it was really more principle then money. To top it off, and now that Im a little pissed, I look the bill over carefully and noticed they had charged me twice for room serivice one day. I pointed it out and he said "when you get home you can call out accounting department"...I said, well, how about fixing it now...he just looked at me but wouldn't correct it. I would be very careful staying here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: CBTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Smallish but historic hotel in a great Back Bay location. Short walk to Fenway. Starbucks and Capital Grill around the corner. Rooms are large, tastefully decorated. Staff is friendly and does little things like hitting the down button on the elevator when they see you coming. If you don't want the typical chain hotel experience, the Eliot is perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke/Service Problem”
Reviews.Author: tdco
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay at the Eliot we specified a non-smoking room, which was provided, except that the air vent in the bathroom literally poured fresh cigarette smoke either from another part of the hotel or outside directly into our bathroom. Because we got in late and were tired we shut the door to the bathroom and went to sleep. When we woke up and brought the problem to the attention of the front desk (who visited the room to confirm the problem), they promised to provide us with another bathroom to shower and get ready for the rest of our trip in. They were unable to do this before we left, and said that because we booked through hotels.com they could not do anything else for us. All in all, for the price and four star rating, I was very unsatisfied with this hotel and their service/smoke problem. On the plus side, the location on Commonwealth Ave and near Newberry street and Fenway is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: MrsNP712
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Eliot and couldn't really fault it. We had a suite on the 9th floor which was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. We were offered turn-down service every night and the staff couldn't be more accomodating, from doorman to restaurant/bar staff. We didn't carry a single piece of luggage - there was always someone there to do it for us. I would highly recommend this hotel and would give it a 4.5 star rating if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wished we could sleep...”
Reviews.Author: peace_all
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel as a well priced centralish hotel, in a good area. The price was right, and service great, but we found the bed to be horrid, traffic noise loud (older windows), drafty, and the room bright as the window blinds didn't close all the way, after two nights we switched to a hotel that was more central with much more comfortable beds. The location was awesome, great walks down nice streets, and the neighbourhood felt very safe walking at night. Nice cafe's and resturants on nearby streets (less then a block away). Whatever you value make your choice, but ultimately comfort was ours.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a luxery hotel”
Reviews.Author: hiway61
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business. They offer valet parking at $36 per day. While we were taking our bags out of the car (we hadn't even had a chance to check in) one of the valets brought another guest's car around to the entrance and backed directly into our car while parking. TWICE. Management was very confrontational about it, and had the attitude that we were making a big deal out of nothing. The next morning there was no electricity in my room. I had to put my contact lenses in at the window sill using a compact mirror. Couldn't shave because the bathroom is an interior room with no natural light, consequently went through the business day unshaven. I walked past a stack of dirty dishes on the floor in the hall near the elevator at 6pm, they were still there when I checked out the next day. I've had better stays at budget motels.

Reviews.Title: “Red Eye Arrival”
Reviews.Author: NahlaLondon
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at The Eliot Hotel at the 11th hour and was really pleased that they could accomodate me. I only needed my room for a few hours in the morning as I was arriving straight off an overnight flight from LA. The staff checking me in at 6AM were really helpful and offered a free checkout extension which was great. They also booked me table at a great restaurant for my client lunch later that afternoon. My suite was very comfortable and clean. The a/c was quite noisy as was the heating installation but I got used to the noise in the end. The only issue with the suite was in the bathroom where there was a leak however as i was only staying for 4 hrs it didnt really matter. The staff were really helpful except for the afternoon receptionist who was rude and agressive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful All-Around”
Reviews.Author: MMM8
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Elliot twice now and both times have had a great experience. The first time, we were with our grown son, so booked a two-bedroom suite. If you need that much room, the Elliott's two-bedroom suite is a genuine bargain, substantially more room for substantially less money than two nice hotel rooms anywhere in the area. The second time we were on our own, so booked just the one-bedroom suite. Again, the rate was competitive with most rooms in the area and the accommodations were quite a bit better in terms of space and comfort. Both visits, I asked the front desk if it might be possible to borrow an electric kettle for brewing my own tea, and both times they managed to come up with one. When we wanted a bucket of ice, they brought it to the door within a few minutes. And it really is worth the price to have breakfast at Clio's at least once during your stay. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are quiet (we were on the second floor, right on the corner of Commonwealth and Mass Ave, and it was still quiet, maybe due to the air handling system), the towels and robes are thick and plentiful, and the beds are excellent, puffy with high-thread-count sheets. If I would change anything, I might be tempted to have one less piece of furniture in the sitting room; it was just a little crowded. But overall, a great place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Early Hotel Charmed in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jnjmoore
Reviews.Content: The hotel Eliot is an old-school charmer with top-notch service. I stayed in an upstairs suite (room 808, I think) for a recent business trip and it was spacious and comfortable with nicely appointed furniture and layout.. It is located in a great part of the Back Bay area in Boston with great shopping and easy access to several great landmarks such as Fenway Park, Newbury Street, and is a quick jaunt over the Charles River to Cambridge. I very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK - are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: lovelux
Reviews.Content: I was really tossing up between the Eliot Hotel and the Four Seasons. I always check Frommer's and Trip Advisor and after careful thought, we selected the Eliot. It was a bit less money for a good size room and the reviews I read were all very good. BIG MISTAKE. This hotel is small, old, dirty and not well located. I have NO IDEA what Frommer's was thinking. The room was large but the beds were awful, the bathrooms moldy, the carpets dirty and the lobby dark and dingy. We had booked to stay here for 3 nights and after a long drive with a 4 year old, we were NOT IMPRESSED upon arrival. It was late so we stayed anyway but called the Four Seasons right away and booked two nights for the following day. We were greeted with drunks and police sirens all night. Absolutely TERRIBLE! I was so disgusted with myself for having chosen this hotel. Management needs to get some upkeep and updating started.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, uncomfortable, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: harudenver
Reviews.Content: staff gave us incorrect directions to a venue and we were lost in the city and late for the wedding. we could hear everything going on in the rooms adjacent, so needless to say, we did not get any sleep. no one helped us with our bags. all in all, we paid premium rates for this less than average accomodation. definitely NOT a luxury hotel. if you want luxury, stick to the four seasons or the ritz-carlton. otherwise, the westin and the marriott copley square are much better places to stay. we will NEVER stay here again. better off staying at a days inn or motel 6!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldwanderingwoman
Reviews.Content: A great location on Massachusetts and Commonwealth avenues for access to shops, restaurants, and areas to walk. It was a bit farther from the Public Gardens than we'd realized, but if we'd had enough time it still would have been easy walking distance. The restaurant located in the hotel, Clio, was excellent--definitely not the standard hotel restaurant fare--and we were glad we'd selected it from the various options in the neighborhood. The hotel and room felt like an elegant European hotel, though the room size was larger than most small European hotels. The staff was fantastic and we will definitely return there whenever their prices are competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneRI
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in the Back Bay section of Boston was a treat for my husband and me. We visit Boston often, because our son attends college there. The cost was very reasonable, and for less that what we usually pay for a tiny room at the nearby Hilton, we had a beautiful suite with complimentary cookies. The room was very clean. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Something2say
Reviews.Content: We found most hotels to be expensive in the area that we wanted to stay, but got a reasonable rate at this hotel. This is a quaint hotel with lots of charm. The staff was attentive and friendly. Always quick to offer a "hello". The interior was clean and modern. Good location to access public transportation to tour the city. Only negative was the air conditioning which never seemed to cool the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, best in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just excellent! Everything is perfect: service, rooms, restaurant, location! There are just no things I can think of which are not good... The staff is so friendly and helpful, amazing! The nice decor and size of the rooms are superb! This is absolut the number 1 hotel in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “A Place I Call Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: preetam2u
Reviews.Content: I am a bussiness traveller and travel frequently to Boston, I have tires diftrent hotels but until recently i found this beauty of a place called 'The Eliot Hotel'. Upon arrival at the Logan International Airport I was told that my luggage hadnot been loaded on my plane and will have to wait 24 hours for it to arrive. so i headed to my next destination The Eliot Hotel. Upon arrival i informed the staff at the desk that my luggage would be arriving later and sould be informed when it does. Upon hearing my story they quickly offered any assistance that I may need. I was also given a complimentary upgrade wow. the suite was just beautiful and after a long trip I was hoping to get a good night sleep which is some times not possible in hotel rooms, its either noise or smelling carpet etc, but I found i had a good night sleep in my suite it was perfect . I had a great Breakfast and dinner at clio restaurant on my first day. And yes my Baggage did arrive the next day late in the evening. Overall I think, I would be staying at The Eliot Hotel every time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant staff, uncomfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Cramer07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with another couple at the Eliot for 3 nights over the 4th of July. We knew that staying in downtown Boston would be expensive, especially over the 4th. Luckily, through a discount program I was able to book a suite with 2 double beds for $267 a night, more than a hundred dollars cheaper than the going rate. However, even with the cheaper rate, we feel we didn't get our money's worth out of the hotel. First....the good. The staff was very friendly all around. The doorman, bellman, and front desk staff were always very pleasant (with or without receiving a tip). It is a great location for shopping and to go to Fenway. However, the building and accomodations had problems. I realize the building is very old, but to bill this as a 5-star hotel, some improvements should be made. Some problems were understandable (weak shower pressure, musty smell in the hallway, etc.) But some problems were plain unacceptable, even for a $80 a night room at Super 8. After looking closely at the comforters on both beds, the white fabric was stained in many places with who-knows-what. It really grossed me out so we didn't even use those blankets. I am about 6ft 2in tall and unfortunately the beds didn't accomodate my heighth and they are very hard. The windows allow a lot of nighttime noise in from the street below, so we shoved pillows around the frame to muffle the noise. They have 2 restaurants in the hotel, but both were closed during our entire stay because of the holiday. That didn't make sense to me, but it would have probably been too expensive for us anyway. But the worst part is that after our 2nd night, my friend's wife woke up with itchy little bites all over her legs. All in all, the Eliot seems to be pre-occupied with appearance and creating the "image" of luxury hotel. But to me, luxury is defined as ultimate comfort, and we were not comfortable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal12359
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. My mother, sister and I stayed for 4 nights in June 2007 to do the Freedom Trail, history, etc. The service at this hotel is impeccable. Our room was darling with beautiful fabrics. It was very clean. Every staff person we ran into was extremely friendly and helpful. If they are in the vicinity of the elevator when you are in the hall, they would push the button for it. The doormen were very friendly as well as the desk staff. They accommodated our every need quickly and efficiently. I highly recommend this historic, sweet hotel. By the way, the T line subway was a nice surprise. Having never ridden in a subway car I was impressed with the cleanliness and the attendants were very helpful and nice (preferred to the taxi drivers which where a bit scary and expensive).

Reviews.Title: “A Back Bay Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Ukiahdds
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Eliot Hotel, arriving June 14. From the moment we checked in, the staff was courteous and efficient. I don`t recall ever staying anywhere with this kind of service. Our room was a suite with the bedroom seperated by French doors. It was very well appointed and quiet if the windows were closed. The Eliot is situated in a very pretty neighborhood with many brick homes and apartments and it fits right in. It is quite old, but they have done an excellent job of blending the ambience of the past with the conveniences of the 21st century. The king size bed was very comfortable. Our son was with us, and the sofa-bed in the sitting room was not as comfortable, but they were kind enough to provide a foam pad when we asked, which helped. Cabs are readily available at the Eliot, and the subway is only a couple of blocks away. It is very convenient to Fenway Park and shopping and restaurants. All in all, the Eliot is a wonderful hotel, perhaps the nicest we`ve ever stayed in. It is a little pricey, but all Boston appears to be. In this case, you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at the Elliot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bethr777
Reviews.Content: Last Friday, I booked a suite for my daughter and I at the Elliot. I drove about 31/2 hours from NY, to help her move from one section of Boston to another. After a full day, and evening, we got back to our suite at around 10:00. We were tired, and I had a long drive to make,alone the next day; so we went to sleep at around 10:30. From 10:30 until about 12:30, we were both tossing and turning, because as soon as we'd fallen asleep, we were awakened by blaring horns which sounded as if they were mere feet from our room. I called the front desk, and they told me we could move to a quieter room down the hall. We dragged our tired selves over to the other room, opened the door, and discovered other peoples' belongings there. We called the from desk back, and they said we could go to a diffierent room, four floors down from us. By that time, I had finally drawn opened the drapes, only to discover that the window was broken, and opened very widely. My daughter, and I somehow managed to close the broken window, and finally went to sleep, at around 2:00 am. After waking up at around 7:00, to get ready to do more moving and drive back to NY, we walked over to Starbucks and ate breakfast; ( The breakfasts at the hotel were a fortune!) When we got back to our room, we discovered the broken window had fallen on my bed. Thank goodness I wasn't sitting or sleeping there. By this time, I was totally exhausted. I explained the situation to the manager, who offered to reimburse me $60.00 off the price of the almost $400.00 a night room, plus the $34.00 I spent on parking. I thought this was most unfair, and was told to contact the general manager on Monday. When I finally contacted her, she agreed to give me another $100.00 back. Frankly, I don't think I should have had to pay anything for a room with a broken window that let all the street noise in, and kept us awake most of the night! We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: cmtmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Eliot after spending a wonderful night at the Lenox. The Eliot is closer to The Boston Conservatory, so that is where I initially wanted to stay, but there was no room the first night, so we stayed at the Lenox. The rather small but charming lobby of the Eliot was somewhat chaotic as a large group was checking out. It was raining when we arrived in the evening and there was no doorman to greet us or bellman to help us with the bags. There were steps to enter the hotel and steps to go down to the lobby and carrying the luggage was not easy. The room was nicely decorated. Clean bathrooms, cute window seats, very charming. The beds were very comfortable. In room internet access was a $10 charge, which I think should have been included. Turn down service was offered nightly. The neighborhood is very convenient to shopping (Newberry Street) and is very close to both Berklee and The Boston Conservatory. Upon checking out, once again...no help. Lugging bags to the street and hailing a cab ourselves. After arriving home, I received $10.00 fee adjustment on my bill for a luggage tag. I was told I had taken this from the room. I can assure you, I have no luggage tag. I have asked for this fee to be removed, and was told that it would be, but as of today, it still remains.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, in good location, minor issue with noise”
Reviews.Author: The_Rochdalien
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eliot for 4 nights just after Easter. The Hotel is very charming, well appointed and presented. It is clean and follows good green practice with towels and linen. The staff were always friendly and effiicient. The location is excellent being one small block from the Transit station, close to the freeway and only 25 minutes from Logan Airport. The general area is very nice, lots of great cafes, restaurants and shops. The Prudential Tower is close by for some great sightseeing. Our only gripe would be the noise at the rear of the hotel - our room overlooked several air-conditioning ducts \ fans and the I-90 freeway so noise was at times a little intrusive. A free to use internet facility was on offer. On the whole, we would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Perfectly appointed room and bath. It is a charming place that you either love or hate at once.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Old Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereWorcester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eliot for 1 night. (Convention in town) Not sure where the negative review came from, but we were very pleased with the Eliot. No, there was no view from the room but an alleyway, but hey! the hotel is on Commonwealth Ave in the city and was not designed for the view...Room was very clean, service was outstanding and everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant and unfailingly helpful. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josh88b
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here and their inclusion on the Conde Nast Traveller Gold List I was shocked by the Eliot Hotel. The staff is incompetent, fond of giving incorrect answers to questions and seem to be totally unsupervised. My wife and I checked into our room to discover a shower that fell apart when you turned the knob and outfitted with a shower head that would be unacceptable for a Motel 6. A door that seemed to house part of the heating system refused to stay closed although neither of us ever opened it which may or may not have also had something to do with the room's refusal to remain warm enough for a winter night. We were attending a wedding next door and upon returning at 10 past 12 were told that a limited room service menu was available. We ordered a turkey sandwich and after being told that it would take 45 minutes to an hour for the crack staff to put even that simple meal together settled in to wait for our meal. 15 minutes later we received a call telling us that there was no turkey sandwich left - these things happen but how in the world does it take a hotel that pretends to be high class and well appointed by professional staff that long to discover there isn't any turkey in the house. Especially when it's one of only three things you're allowed to order past the arbitrary midnight cutoff. The housekeeping staff pounds on the door at 6:15 Sunday night for turndown, we were on our way out shortly thereafter and asked them to return later. When we got home from the event we found an untouched room, par for the course for this mess of a hotel. Stay elsewhere in Boston, the Eliot is not worth your time nor your money.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: dbrown46
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews of where to stay in Boston, we settled on the Eliot Hotel and we are very happy we made that decision. The hotel is ideally located less than one block from the green line T in Back Bay. Newbury Street shops are an easy stroll and we easily walked to Boston Common, Beacon Hill, Downtown and even to the North End (we had good weather!). The bus to Harvard also stops right at the corner and cabs were easy hailed by the doormen. Service is very efficient and friendly, from opening doors and helping with luggage to efficient check in and check out to room service requests for a refrigerator, extra glasses and ice to an accommodating business center. The room we had was a spacious 6th floor suite with lots of space. The room was incredibly quiet, there was lots of hot water and strong water pressure and there were windows which opened (the hotel is kept a little too warm for my taste). Furnishings were very tasteful and bed linens were very comfortable. We were upgraded to this suite and charged $235 per night. For a tourist, I think this is the best location and value in Boston since when you return from (easily accessible) sightseeing, your home away from home is in a very safe neighborhood with many restaurants and shops. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice, warm and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: davidfisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over a November weekend, given a quiet and quite spacious 6th floor suite. The combination of well decorated bedroom and a separate living room (more than big enough for 5 people to sit in comfort) was a winner, especially compared to a 'brand' hotel. There were loads of staff on duty in the lobby on returning to the hotel in the late afternoon, but bizarrely a pot of tea took between 20 and 30 minutes each time to get to the room. Kettles are needed for each room, and also individual safe deposits in the room, rather that just at reception. The hotel restaurant Clio is seriously ambitious, and obviously very popular with Bostonians, extremely intense flavours, quite rich - and of course expensive! We liked the Eliot, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lstein
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel right in the back bay. Very close to fenway park.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, comfort”
Reviews.Author: vacsrus
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Very comfortable beds. In walking distance to Fenway, right by a T stop, and right by Newbury Street. Very service-oriented as far as helping with luggage, doors and cabs; providing a T map; including turn-down service (and chocolates!) without being asked; and filling the ice bucket nightly without being asked. Staff was friendly, greeting us as we came and went. Room was kept clean, with towels/toiletries restocked regularly. Yeah, you're paying for it, but many other hotels we looked at cost more, and we could find no drawbacks at the Eliot.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: CEK1
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at The Eliot. The first was my honeymoon in September 2001. Then, we chose The Eliot because it had always supported the public interest organization at my law school by donating vouchers for our annual auction. Based on how much my husband and I enjoyed the 2001 stay, I returned for a four-day business and personal trip five years later. During the interval, The Eliot only got better. For a city hotel, the rooms are spacious and inviting, with a pleasant, comfortable, but sophisticated mix of traditional and contemporary furnishings. The color scheme trends toward the browns and golds, with touches of blue and lovely, clean white in the bathroom. A particular plus is the walk-in closet, which is easily four times the size of the closet you would find in any other hotel. At $265/night, The Eliot is an exceptional value. I appreciated the superb customer service that I received not only from the hotel staff--delivery of business FedExes and faxes was lightning-swift--but also from the cordial and highly professional wait staff in Clio. I dined alone there on a Wednesday night and felt particularly well cared for and well-fed. The wireless internet access in the office area of the room was hampered initially by interference, but the front desk promptly had the service provider contact me, and the provider assured that front desk staff brought me a bridge, readily solving the problem. I had four highly productive days at The Eliot, punctuated by enjoyable exchanges with friendly, competent, diverse staff and pleasant short walks around the lovely Back Bay. Based on two experiences over five years as both a leisure and a business traveler, I would recommend The Eliot without hesitation, and plan to treat this exceptional small hotel as my first choice for all future travel to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Back Bay Choice”
Reviews.Author: j9289
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I just spent two nights and were impressed by this hotel, which certainly deserves the great recognition and reviews it gets. The location is fine - my wife enjoyed being near Newbury and my son enjoyed being near Fenway Park - and why someone would want to stay at the Ritz-Carlton or Four Seasons rather than this well-appointed, intimate place with a great restaurant downstairs is beyond me. Our one complaint was with the parking - it's valet (of course) but the front desk didn't tell us (or any of the other guests who checked out the day we left) of the wait time for our car to be retrieved, which delayed our departure quite considerably. Be prepared for as much as an hour's wait!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby daughter and I stayed in the Eliot Hotel for one night after a weeklong trip to Cape Cod. We wanted to stay in Boston Saturday night to be close to the airport for our Sunday morning flight. We have stayed in several hotels in Boston over the years and we were thrilled with this hotel. We had a premier suite that was large and perfect for us. The living room was a perfect place to put our daughter in her pack n play and she slept late the next day because of the wonderful draperies blocking the light (until you open them-we had a great view of Commonwealth Ave.!!) Were able to close the french doors to our bedroom and watch a little tv without disturbing her. The rooms are beautifully and tastefully decorated. Our room was in hues of blue and chocolate brown. The bathroom was restored, but still had beautiful old white marble and a seperate area to put on your makeup with good lighting. There is also a seperate wet bar area off of the living room that was a great space to keep our daughter supplies, food and bottles. The bed was very comfortable and my husband really enjoyed the wireless internet. The Eliot is also in a fabulous location and just a short walk to so many wonderful restaurants and shops. We were sad that we were only staying one night, but are delighted to have found a favorite hotel in Boston.

HotelInfo.Name: Eliot Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 370 Commonwealth Ave., Boston, MA 02215
